characters: THE CENTER OF THE ICE RAFT
THE ICE AXE AND THE GUN
ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE WIRE

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: An unparalleled set of sheer mountains -- part of the Col Rockies. The peaks rise a challenging half mile and more of the valley -- wind-whipped snow mists over the mountai like a low fog. The tranquility is broken as a helicopter BLASTS into view, fighting the wind as it heads for the c of it all. Our CREDITS fly us past and through this magnificent rang There are sky-piercing peaks that slope up to a narrow, h pinnacle -- and others that are steel, straight-up approa to large plateaus. One of the mountains has a crystal lak top -- with a waterfall that drains from it and exits fro middle of a mountain wall. Nearby, an abandoned cable lad is bolted into the same wall, leading to the top.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: We can see a man sitting in its doorway, looking out --

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: The glasses scan systematically, slowly -- to us, it look like nothing more than a field of gray and white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter now circles this tallest mountain -- "The Tower", separated from a lower but equally formidable pea a chasm of two hundred feet -- that drops 3,500 feet belo

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Spotter FRANK NEWELL (50s) scans the mountain wall.  MAGG DEIGHAN (30s) expertly pilots the helicopter through the winds. Both wear orange jackets identifying themselves as members of the Rocky Mountain Park Rescue Team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute -- there's Hal. (beat) And his date.

dialogues.speaker: A LEDGE
dialogues.text: that's part of the smaller peak. HAL TUCKER (30s) and his "date", SUSAN COLLINS (20s), are decked out in climbing g Hal's aplomb suggests he's a veteran climber -- Susan's worried look shows she isn't. Hal and Susan huddle togeth both cold, but okay. Hal has a makeshift splint wrapped around his lower leg, and a slow burning flare in one han

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Frank lowers his glasses -- Maggie struggles with the win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do they look?

dialogues.speaker: HAL AND SUSAN
dialogues.text: Hal, now aware of the copter, looks towards it, smiling - starts jerking off the flare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's signalling "okay."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Gabe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POV dips down -- there's somebody climbing below, in orange rescue jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right where he's supposed to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is GABE WALKER (30s). In spite of the cold and the s he's fearlessly, swiftly scaling the tower without safety lines, as if he's done it a hundred times. That's because has done it a hundred times. This is what Gabe lives for.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LEDGE
dialogues.text: Gabe, almost there, finds a fingertip-width handhold at a length -- grabbing it, he pulls himself up on the ledge w move that's just a little tougher than chinning yourself doorjamb. Winded, Gabe slumps down next to the couple, an tries to light a cigarette. The lighter only sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me -- I know you're my salvation, and all -- do you think you could rescue us before your smoke break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal pulls out a box of wooden matches and lights one Boga style, one-handed with a thumbnail, cupping a hand to shi it against the wind. Gabe bends down for it -- a familiar routine. We know in a glance they've been friends for yea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you could tell me why I am rescuing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically -- I've fallen down, and I can't get up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Rescue One -- have located helpless climber, please prepare idiot line for transport, over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HELICOPTER dips down towards the ledge -- no way can land there. Frank lowers a rescue wire to

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: who precariously swings out from the ledge to grab it -- wire is just out of reach. Hal grabs the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescue One -- please remind me to tell you about the time I hauled your hero here down Mt. Huntington on my back, over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through radio) Hal, if I hear that story one more time, I'm making you limp down the entire three thousand feet, over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe finally grabs the line, secures it to a heavy piton, hammers it into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Susan) This guy showing you a good time?

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: swings over across to the facing mountain -- Maggie lands copter, in spite of the winds, on a small plateau. Frank out to secure the wire -- there's now a lifeline spanning chasm.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LEDGE
dialogues.text: Gabe finishes anchoring the line in the rock -- he extinguishes his cigarette in the snow, and naturally, po the butt. Hal, propped up against the wall, expertly rigs seat harness around his legs -- Susan helps him get part around his splint, and Gabe clips it to the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, remember -- keep your arms and legs within the vehicle at all times --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Fuck you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Hal pulls himself hand-over-hand across the sl line -- Hal makes a point of looking down --

dialogues.speaker: THE DROP
dialogues.text: is vertigo defined. Thirty five hundred feet straight dow You could stack the World Trade Center towers on top of e other and they'd still be shorter than this mountain is h However --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: lets go of the overhead line and claps his hands to his f in mock horror -- he quickly whizzes down the last thirty of the line, where Frank catches him and pulls him out. H gets out of the harness, checks every stitch of it, signa thumbs-up, and sends it back.

dialogues.speaker: THE LEDGE
dialogues.text: Gabe, retrieves the harness on a small attachment line, a gives Susan a reassuring smile, but she's still, sensibly very scared. Gabe recovers the harness, rigs Susan into i and meticulously re-checks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready? (sees she's afraid) Did he tell you about the time he almost made it up Everest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said you gave him a bad oxygen mask --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if he's bored you with that bullshit, then this has to be the best part of a bad date. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan nervously laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared but tough) Okay --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe starts to push her out on the line, but she grabs hi in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan starts to tilt her head down -- Gabe gently takes h of her chin, turning her view up to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can. (reassuring) You can do it. Don't look down.  The whole way across, don't look down. Look at me. Just keep looking at me -- and you'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan looks at Gabe -- trying to be confident -- nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) I have always depended on the kindness of Rangers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe grins and gently pushes her out. Susan tentatively p herself across -- then develops a rhythm, building speed

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: inching away in the harness, looking more confident now -

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: signalling "OK" -- "you're doing fine" --

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: thirty feet out, going fine --

dialogues.speaker: A HARNESS CLIP
dialogues.text: holding the strap under Susan's left leg breaks --

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: The harness completely unravels all at once, its strands shoot through the clips -- what was a seat has become a t door in half a second -- as the harness shoots out from u her, Susan falls but grabs the harness strand --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: is helpless, and can only watch as

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: too scared to breathe, dangles on the remaining strand of used to be the harness -- she sways from the wind and the of her own weight, her grip loosens --

dialogues.speaker: THE TOP CLIP
dialogues.text: that is supporting all of Susan's weight is being serious tested -- a single knot in the harness has caught there, it clearly won't last long --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: moves back from the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud, in control) Hold on. I'm coming out to get you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe gently pulls himself up on the line, crosses his ank on it, and clips himself on with a three foot safety line Gabe starts smoothly, quickly pulling himself out, but --

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: is in trouble -- the bobbing of the line from Gabe's weig and the winds are making her lose her grip even more --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: urgently pulls himself along the line faster, trying not shake the line. As he gets closer and closer to a terrifi Susan, his eyes lock on hers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep looking at me. Hold on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe is only ten feet away from --

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: who stares at Gabe, petrified -- this focus is helping, b her strength is just about gone --

dialogues.speaker: THE CLIP
dialogues.text: The knot has worked itself halfway through -- it doesn't any difference how tight she holds on to the harness, the harness itself is letting go --

dialogues.speaker: ON GABE
dialogues.text: who knows it and pulls himself the rest of the way, a lit faster, almost bridging the gap --

dialogues.speaker: ON SUSAN
dialogues.text: staring desperately at Gabe, holding on --

dialogues.speaker: THE TOP CLIP
dialogues.text: that's keeping Susan alive surrenders the knot -- it pass through, and

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: falls --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: deliberately lets go of the main line and launches himsel at Susan --

dialogues.speaker: THEIR HANDS
dialogues.text: miss --

dialogues.speaker: BOTH
dialogues.text: Gabe's three foot safety line pulls taut, testing the lim of the line above as it yanks him back --

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: is just out of reach -- her hand is still stretched out, eyes still locked on

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: who can only look down, swaying helplessly on the wire as Susan's SCREAM starts --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE
dialogues.text: Frank and Maggie look down in horror, but neither look as anguished as Hal --

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: falling -- falling -- falling -- looking very small again the vast mountain range --

dialogues.speaker: FALLING
dialogues.text: from this height takes the longest nineteen seconds you c imagine --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: twists from his safety line, spinning helplessly -- he wa to, but can't, shut his eyes --

dialogues.speaker: THE CHASM
dialogues.text: Susan is gone. Her SCREAM, cut short, echoes -- the "safe harness spirals down after her like a carefree bird --

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT SMALL AIRLINER
dialogues.text: As the plane dips to land, Gabe can see a bird circling f below, over the same mountainous terrain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sweating, panting, awake. It hasn't been that long since accident -- a year, to be exact -- but he looks older. He looks as if he's watched Susan Collins drop at least one hundred times. Gabe reels himself in as a STEWARDESS hand a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this. (Gabe does) Afraid of flying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe, with no luggage, is at the small airport's only car rental counter, doing the paperwork for a RENTAL AGENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midsize?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any size, any color, any model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will you be needing it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flat) Just under six hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You aren't wasting any time, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe turns and looks at

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: who is standing off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd be coming by. Today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe's happy to see her -- but at the same time, he isn't She looks too good -- and she brings up quite a mixed bag memories. Maggie carves on a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're in that much of a hurry, why don't you ride with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie pilots the copter, heading out toward the mountain range. Gabe fiddles with some of the equipment inside. Bo grope for a way to start the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is new...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a thermal scope -- picks up body heat of lost hikers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe flicks it on, looks at the total absence of heat as fly over the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still find the dead ones the old fashioned way, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for small talk. Gabe is clearly uneasy watching t mountains go by. Maggie breaks an awkward silence --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have said goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head) If I did, I'd have to listen to you tell me one more time that it wasn't my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Today -- especially today -- you get to hear it again. The harness clip broke.  Cold stress -- one in a million equipment failure. You and Hal could have checked it from then till now and it still would have happened. (beat) You did everything right --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- If I did everything right, Susan Collins would still be alive.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: whizzes on to the Ranger station -- a small building by a country road. Not much activity outside of some ROOKIE CLIMBERS working out on a CLIMBING PRACTICE WALL. Maggie starts to land the copter, and as she does --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really believe all that?  That it wasn't our fault?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie slows the rotor, her eyes on the controls. Gabe's are locked on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Gabe) Yes. Yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she answered a half beat too slow. The helicopter tou ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure what I wish more, Maggie. That you meant what you said, just now -- or that it were really true then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, wearing Sheriff's garb, storms towards Maggie's side the copter as the engine shuts off and the rotor dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie, where the hell have you been? I've got two climbers out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe gets out of the copter, and Hal sees him for the fir time. Unlike the last time we saw them, neither man is gl see the other. Hal turns on Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brett and Evan are up there again to jump off the spur. Their wives called twice. I want you in the air and I want them found before the storm system moves in. (Maggie hesitates) Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie takes off as Gabe and Hal step away from the copte Gabe eyes Hal's uniform and almost -- not quite but almos laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ. You're in charge of Rescue now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a vacancy. Maybe you heard about it. The last guy lost his nerve and lit out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're a better man than I am, Hal. Nothing rattles you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rookie climbers get off the practice wall to watch th faceoff. Gabe and Hal are one crack away from beating hel of each other. Frank heads over to defuse the confrontati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steering Gabe away) Gabe! Long time, son -- why don't you come meet some of the new guys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea. Say, Hal? (beat) Why don't you come with me so we can show these rookies how to death-rig a woman properly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That tears it -- Hal rushes Gabe and they pummel each oth until Frank and the others pull them apart, panting and bleeding.  Hal throws off the men holding him back -- but instead of going at Gabe again, Hal throws Gabe a set of keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the Bronco to where you're going. I've already been. Then go back to wherever it is you like to hide. And stay there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal heads back into the office -- Gabe heads for the Bron

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Southwest regional center for printing and distributi currency. Hundreds of troops stand guard over the impress U.S. Treasury complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is at work -- the ROAR of its parts is deafening as it st out a plate design on huge sheets of paper -- we move in

dialogues.speaker: THE PAPER
dialogues.text: which is moved by mechanical arm to a SLICER that razors bills apart -- it's moving too fast for us to see the denomination -- the cut bills are separated by --

dialogues.speaker: FOUR SEPARATION CHUTES
dialogues.text: that fire the bills down to a mechanical COUNTER that serializes, counts, bands and stacks them faster than any human could -- a HAND reaches to pick up a band --

dialogues.speaker: THE BILLS
dialogues.text: are something a banker could work a lifetime without seei but are real nonetheless --  $5,000 bills, banded here in hundreds. The band is put back in the growing stack by

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD TRAVERS
dialogues.text: mid-thirties, a tough, imposing Treasury agent -- he rega the fortune piling up in front of him with only cold, professional interest. Travers is flanked by a trio of eq tough TREASURY AGENTS -- he turns to flunky DAVIS (20s). clear who's in charge of protecting the money here, and w in charge of counting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Wright the San Francisco shipment is ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (phone already out) Right away, Mr. Travers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Davis dials we move to --

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICE
dialogues.text: of WALTER WRIGHT (50s), comptroller of currency -- his demeanor suggests he's in control, and used to keeping it way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Good -- good. I'll be right down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Wright gets up from his desk, though, we hear in the o office --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go in there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KURT MATHESON (30s) bursts into the office, trailed by Wright's flustered SECRETARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Wright? (flashes badge) Matheson. FBI. We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: PRINTING COMPOUND
dialogues.text: has now been packed into a trio of metal briefcases -- te thousand $5,000 bills. Travers shuts the cases in turn, a locks each with an electronic key card, triggering a FLAS RED LIGHT on the locks as he does. A uniformed PILOT show behind Travers as he cuffs the cases to the hands of the other agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be fueled and ready in ten minutes, Mr. Travers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an order) Be ready in five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and take ten. We'll need the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers looks up at Matheson, who has just arrived with Wright. Travers is instantly furious at the challenge to authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flashes badge) Matheson. FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down at it) Your parents must be proud. (to Wright) What the fuck is this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small problem with the shipment, Travers. (to Matheson) Tell him what you just told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson draws out a file and hands it to Travers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got word that somebody's been observing your currency shipments -- this load, the $5,000s -- over the last three deliveries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) There isn't a hell of a lot anyone can do but observe. (beat) This is the most protected shipment we've got -- and the most useless for a thief. Those bills aren't in circulation. You think five thousand dollar bills are easy to pass? Who the fuck would try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson hands Travers a folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look over Travers' shoulder at the photos, which are a blurry, all blown up from different surveillance pictures and all of them show ERIC QUALEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patient) His name's Eric Qualen. One of the East German spies who got shut out by the reunification. The CIA issued an inter-agency warning about him right after the wall came down. He's got nowhere to go and nothing to lose. He's also got the international connections to get rid of bills like these -- and he's probably desperate enough to try for them. Fifty million bucks buys a lot of sanctuary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you get to the part where I'm supposed to care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shows him more photos) We had two agents monitoring him. These two -- Gleason and Quinones. Their last report said he was going to try to take this shipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning away) Thanks for the tip. But I've got work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping him) Did I say "last" report? I think I did. I mean last fucking report. These guys have vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have my sympathy, but -- (exasperated) There's a reason we do things this way, all right? Armored cars can be hijacked. Trains can be derailed. But nobody can get to us in flight. The only time this is on the ground is at the mint, or on the Presidio runway in San Francisco. Either way, someone would have to shoot his way past a couple of thousand guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson still isn't convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're worried about an inside job, forget it. I checked the plane from top to bottom an hour ago. And these three are my best against. Even if one of them did go skydiving, they wouldn't get far. Each case has an electronic tracer with a range of one hundred miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers pulls a tracking device about the size of a watch out of his jacket pocket. The small screen shows three re blips at rest -- matching the three currency cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (facing down Matheson) I haven't lost a bill in eight years. And I'm not scrubbing this shipment because you scare easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an easy smile) Who said anything about stopping the shipment? (beat) I've been tracking Qualen for almost a year. If he pulls something, I want to be in on the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers, angry, turns to Wright. Wright clearly doesn't l this either, but is resigned to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is cleared from the top, Travers. Matheson will accompany you on the flight to San Francisco. (beat) Show him every professional courtesy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers turns back to a smiling Matheson, looking like he rather kill him instead, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is being buffeted by storm winds and a light snow -- Magg struggles hard with the controls, but --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Visibility is near zero. Maggie keys the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescue One to base, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescue One -- have you sighted them? Over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, Hal -- storm's already moving in -- I can't see them, and winds are too strong to stay up here -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescue One -- abort. They'll be all right. Brett and Evan are dumb enough not to log in, but they're smart enough to have storm gear. Head back to base. (not unkindly) Maybe you can catch Gabe before he leaves. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he's planning a long visit, Hal. (back to business) Rescue One heading back to base, over and out.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: banks a 180 to fly back -- we can see over the horizon th the storm is moving in fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can hear Maggie's helicopter flying off overhead -- ca inside the cave are BRETT and EVAN, both 20s, both shiver amid their gear -- backpacks, cooking stuff -- and parach These are Colorado rock jocks -- thrillseekers who'll try anything if the odds are strong enough they'll die in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freezing) Way to check the weather, Brett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shivering yet macho) Hey. If it were easy, it wouldn't be worth d-doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DC-9 cruises over increasingly mountainous, remote terrain.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: who looks tense -- we MOVE AROUND the cabin and find two relaxed Treasury agents are dozing on the opposite side o plane, their arms chained to the currency cases. Matheson edgy. Another AGENT offers some condescending reassurance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just enjoy the view, huh? (Matheson says nothing) Relax. I mean, what could happen in the air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson turns back to his window and looks down --

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND BELOW
dialogues.text: is covered with snow -- the jet's shadow moves sleekly an plainly over it. But after a moment we see -- -- another jet's shadow on the ground, coming up fast!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE DC-9
dialogues.text: reacts this and shifts his look upward to --

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PLANE, (GULFSTREAM)
dialogues.text: is flying a parallel course to the Treasury jet, and is j one hundred yards away. Close enough to see Eric Qualen's in one of the windows.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PLANE
dialogues.text: Matheson stands -- Travers has noticed the plane by now t and gets out of his seat as the other agents react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to other agents) Stay put! Don't panic, goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers moves into

dialogues.speaker: THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: where the pilot seems nervous, but oddly, not frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming in too slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool) No -- we're going too fast, and we're too high up. Push flaps forward twenty degrees and drop to five thousand feet.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Matheson is out of his seat, pistol drawn. Seems a little under the circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to agent) You got any rifles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forward compartment -- left side --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson rushes through a curtain to the area between the cabin and the cockpit and pulls open a closet door. To hi horror, he finds inside not rifles, but

dialogues.speaker: TWO DEAD BODIES
dialogues.text: who we'll recognize as the missing FBI agents from the ph Matheson showed Travers.

dialogues.speaker: MATHESON
dialogues.text: backs up in horror -- and he sees Travers calmly coming o the cockpit. Rattled, Matheson pulls his gun on Travers. Travers looks dumbfounded -- then angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checked the plane from top to bottom, huh? You fucker -- (clicks hammer back) Put your hands behind your head! It's over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers puts his hands out and walks forward -- slowly, backing Matheson into the cabin. Not in surrender, but as he's calming a nutcase. The other agents see this and don know which way to jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down -- give the gun to me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to other agents) There's a couple of dead bodies in the front compartment -- they're FBI agents --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's losing it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They now think Matheson is crazy too -- he looks nuts -- other agents move behind him. Matheson gets even more fra and point his gun at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! Don't you see what he's doing! He's hijacking the fucking shipment! (back to Travers) Don't make me shoot you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other two agents get behind Matheson and rapidly disa him. Travers pulls out his gun with a slow, leisurely mov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers FIRES his gun three times, one for each agent's chest -- the agents are cut down, realizing too late what happened. A fourth SHOT knocks Matheson over a seat as if been kicked. Travers puts his gun away and puts on a radi headset as he goes to a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to mouthpiece) Move into position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: maneuvers over the DC-9 -- and holds steady above it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stone reads "Susan Collins -- 1965 - 1991". It's surrounded by wreaths -- one of which has an old snapshot her attached to it. Mementos sent on the first anniversar her death.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: brushes some of the falling snow away from the marker. He down his flowers and pauses for a moment -- then gets int Bronco and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe looks out the window at the countryside he used to b in. He's wondering if he still does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen's jet is now flying parallel to, and slightly abov the Treasury jet. The door in Qualen's jet is open, and w our first good look at --

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. QUALEN'S JET
dialogues.text: -- Qualen, who is also wearing a headset radio and is wir to a safety line in the jet. He's lowering a thick steel down to the Treasury jet. Qualen is as deadly as advertised -- 150 mph winds are te at him through the open door, but he is unfazed and unfrightened.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: is also wired to a safety line by his own jet's open door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) More -- more -- keep it coming --

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO PLANES
dialogues.text: Qualen's jet lowers the cable into the Treasury jet -- it looks like an Air Force midair refuelling -- difficult an dangerous. After about thirty feet of line is lowered --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: -- takes it in and clips it to a ring at the top of the j doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Locked on. Move into lateral position.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE QUALEN'S PLANE
dialogues.text: The pilot, KRISTEL, is a woman. Her skill, like her hard beauty, can be measured in a glance: she's a lot calmer t her counterpart in the Treasury plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving into lateral position.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TWO PLANES
dialogues.text: Qualen's jet lowers itself, banking to the side -- the Treasury jet raises itself. Both are now flying side by s with the cable serving as a thirty foot bridge.

dialogues.speaker: TREASURY JET CABIN
dialogues.text: Travers, unclipped from his safety line, cautiously goes the cockpit. The pilot, nervous, struggles with the contr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're right on the edge of the storm -- let's move it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers pulls the two dead FBI agents out of the compartment -- one is dressed in a flying suit like the p one in a suit like Travers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't going to work -- Wright will suspect something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what. He'll sift though a plane that went down in a storm -- (gestures to bodies) -- find enough pulverized bone for six men heroically killed in the line of duty -- (finds three suitcases) -- and just enough of the right kind of ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers opens one of the cases, which is identical to the others -- except that it's full of one dollar bills. He's thought of everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get twenty-one gun funerals and they write off fifty million. It's perfect, as long as you hold the plane steady -- so concentrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers moves back into the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE QUALEN'S JET
dialogues.text: We can now see four other passengers. All are fit and arm HELDON and RYAN are seated, while KYNETTE and DELMER, rea help with the transfer, are on the opposite side of the d from a very impatient Qualen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Travers -- hurry it up.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE TREASURY JET
dialogues.text: Travers, now in a harness like the one seen earlier -- un the money cases from the agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) On my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers steps back into the cockpit and flips a toggle sw over and LED --

dialogues.speaker: THE LED
dialogues.text: starts counting down from 2:00 -- 1:59 -- 1:58 --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Even in the last minute, the storm's gotten worse -- the is flying right into the blackest center of it. The pilot looks more panicked than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That charge is going to blow both engines -- the plane'll go down like a rock, so clip yourself on to the end of the cable with the money as soon as I get over. (an afterthought) And make sure you bring the right cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers heads back into the cabin and hooks his harness t cable between the planes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the headset) Dip the plane. I'm coming over.

dialogues.speaker: THE JETS
dialogues.text: Qualen's jet dips down so there's a sharp incline -- Trav starts the slide down, zipping in seconds across into

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN'S JET
dialogues.text: where he's pulled in and unclipped by Qualen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting over the wind) Why didn't you send the money over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting too) Somehow, I didn't think you'd have waited for me if I'd sent it first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen smiles in reply. No. Maybe he wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TREASURY PLANE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: The pilot locks the controls and rushes back to the cabin

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TREASURY PLANE CABIN
dialogues.text: The pilot gathers the cases and uses their cuffs to attac them to the cable -- but as he steps past the bodies of -

dialogues.speaker: THE AGENTS
dialogues.text: Matheson's eyes open -- he's not dead yet.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CABIN
dialogues.text: The pilot clicks the last of the three cases onto the cab and is about to put his harness on -- but behind him, Mat shakily crawls to his feet, draws his gun, and SHOOTS the pilot in the back twice.

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: drops out of the plane, flailing -- if he's screaming, we can't hear it over the HOWLING of the storm --

dialogues.speaker: IN QUALEN'S JET
dialogues.text: Qualen and Travers are watching the whole plan unravel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to cockpit) Get underneath the jet! The cases will slide over!

dialogues.speaker: THE JETS
dialogues.text: Qualen's jet sharply dips down and the cases start to sli over -- but at the same time --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TREASURY JET
dialogues.text: Matheson, groggy, holds onto the doorway and FIRES a full from his automatic at Qualen's jet -- and

dialogues.speaker: THE TREASURY JET'S ENGINES
dialogues.text: are destroyed as the charge DETONATES --

dialogues.speaker: THE JETS
dialogues.text: As promised, the Treasury jet is now plummetting as if it no wings at all, levelling the angle between the planes - cases dangle precariously on the wire --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Lower! Get underneath it!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE TREASURY JET
dialogues.text: Matheson struggles to the cockpit and gets behind the con -- as if that's going to do any good --

dialogues.speaker: THE JETS
dialogues.text: Qualen's jet is deliberately racing the disabled Treasury down, but it's hopeless -- there's no way to get undernea the falling jet long enough for the cases to slide over.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE QUALEN'S JET
dialogues.text: isn't quite panicked. Yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dragging us down! Disconnect the cable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heldon and Ryan try to do just that, but the cable is taut -- there's no way to loosen the clip on the door --

dialogues.speaker: BOTH JETS
dialogues.text: dive down faster at an ever steeper angle, over the edge the Colorado mountain range --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TREASURY JET
dialogues.text: -- the clip on the door finally breaks --

dialogues.speaker: BOTH JETS
dialogues.text: -- the Treasury jet drops as Qualen's jet, trailing the c and the money, sharply shoots upward --

dialogues.speaker: THE TREASURY JET
dialogues.text: makes a one point landing nose first into the wilderness, cartwheeling into a FIREBALL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the EXPLOSION, muffled in the wind, far-off, audible, drives Hal outside -- he's alert, but can't see anything in the murk of the storm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: levels off the plane, but it's still in trouble --

dialogues.speaker: CABIN
dialogues.text: struggle to reel in the cable, because --

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE
dialogues.text: The money cases are still, barely, holding on, the cuffs caught on the broken clip at the end --

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN AND TRAVERS
dialogues.text: aren't even bothering with the electric winch, they're dragging it in hand over hand -- but --

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE
dialogues.text: -- the cases, torn by the wind, work their way loose one time and drop -- one -- two -- three -- into the snowy mountains below!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Heldon and Ryan clamp the door shut as Qualen angrily att Travers --

dialogues.speaker: THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: tries to bring the plane up, but can't -- the fuel guage needle is dropping fast --

dialogues.speaker: THE WING
dialogues.text: is pouring out fuel through a dozen bullet holes -- one o engines sputters to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: The plane is now just skirting the mountain tops, and is being battered by storm winds -- Kristel aims it for what looks like the flattest, longest mountain top --

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Kynette and Ryan grab Qualen and Travers to separate them all strap in, because

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANE
dialogues.text: is going down -- it just tops the edge of a precipice and the ground level --

dialogues.speaker: THE MOUNTAIN TOP
dialogues.text: -- the problem is, the ground itself isn't level, it tilt down towards another edge five hundred yards distant -- i plane keeps skidding, it'll go over the edge --

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANE
dialogues.text: sleds down at an angle, skipping over rocks -- -- through trees -- -- tearing off a wing --

dialogues.speaker: THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Kristel rides the stick only out of habit -- nothing she is going to matter now --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CABIN
dialogues.text: The men are jolted around -- windows IMPLODE as Kynette t to protect a bag of what is obviously explosives --

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANE
dialogues.text: rips downhill through a wooded area like a runaway train -- the second wing is sheared off by trees --

dialogues.speaker: THE OPPOSITE EDGE
dialogues.text: is coming up fast -- but

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANE
dialogues.text: wrenches to a sudden halt, the fuselage intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: or what's left of it has stopped several feet short of th edge -- we can see why: the steel cable, trailing from th cargo door, has lashed itself around a half dozen trees, acting as a tripwire to stop the plane.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PLANE
dialogues.text: Quiet. All are dazed but, outside of superficial cuts, unhurt. Kristel moves out of the cockpit, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for phase one. (to Travers) Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She speaks for all of them -- especially a still-seething Qualen. Travers pulls out the tracer monitor for the case The tracer screen shows three distinct blips -- the trace have survived the fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now -- we call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, agitated, paces in the main office -- Frank, unconce puts a coat hanger and some aluminum foil on a little TV drag in the fading signal of a Broncos game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- I know there's a storm, but that wasn't thunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unconcerned) Hal, when you've been in this line as long as I have --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station's scanner radio barks to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicky) Mayday -- mayday -- downed DC-3 --  mayday --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal runs to the radio and keys the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky Mountain Rescue -- come in, mayday --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristel is on the radio, as Travers and Qualen hang back. Kristel's voice is panicked but she can't suppress a grin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downed charter flight alpha-charlie-niner-- (keys mike to "garble" transmission) -- dead, seven seriously wounded, acknowledge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acknowledged, mayday. What's your position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("panicked") Don't know -- position unknown -- landed on top of some mountain -- only visual bearing is a facing cylinder-type formation -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to be Comb Bluff. (keys mike) Acknowledged, mayday. Winds are too strong for us to get a copter up there -- can you and your passengers make it through the storm? Over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative -- cockpit is on fire -- fuselage broken into three sep-- ("garble") --ed in shock.  Need medical supplies, including insulin, repeat, insulin, as soon as po --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead silence. The transmission cuts off/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayday -- come in, mayday --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristel hangs up the radio and smiles, Travers and Qualen standing behind her. Qualen lightly applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad. The insulin was a nice touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bronco wends through a winding country road, coming finally to a cabin settled in a clearing.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: pulls into the driveway and puts the Bronco in park. He doesn't cut the engine, because he's not sure whether he' going in or not. Finally -- he cuts the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knock on the door brings no response -- no one inside. opens the unlocked door -- and steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Gabe takes a look around the living room. His tells us, without a doubt, this used to be his home. Gabe moves inside, pausing at a mantle. Two framed photos -- G and Maggie sleeping together in a hammock, bolted to a sh wall over a 2,000 foot drop. Gabe, Hal and Maggie, all younger, all sporting drunken grins, in a mountain cave. smiles for the first time today at this memory -- a BANGI the back of the cabin shakes him out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: has come open and swings in the wind. Gabe steps outside pulls it shut. Gabe looks down and sees tracks that lead small but sturdy shed a few yards away. Gabe heads over t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a storage shed at all -- it's a small workspace that offers solid protection from the elements, is well-lit, a whistle-clean. Maggie, in front of a table, pulls a cover

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE PLASTIC CAGE
dialogues.text: -- inside is a bald eagle. One of maybe 2,000 left in the country. Its uneven feathering and small, gawky size tell it isn't nearly full grown. A bandage on its side tells u it's been injured. Maggie's smile tells us it's healing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the shed opens -- Gabe steps in, and shuts th door behind him. Maggie looks surprised to see him. Gabe looks awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (beat) Could you introduce us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Gabe Walker -- this is A27. A27 -- Gabe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the tag -- what do you call him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her. I call her Lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bends down, eyes wound) Poachers? (Maggie nods) Bastards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got the mother -- and left this one behind. Too small to make a decent trophy, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About four months, right? (Maggie nods) Christ -- it must have been just about his -- I mean her -- first flight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to change the dressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie pulls on a pair of pair of cowhide gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that alone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had to learn. She trust me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie reaches into the cage, but the eagle starts thrash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making her nervous -- (beat) You hold her, I'll do the dressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe finds another pair of gloves, sterile cotton pads an alcohol in a drawer -- Maggie reaches in and grabs the ea beak and talons quickly but gently, and takes it out of t cage, holding it firm. This is clearly something they've many times before. They move together, tight -- Gabe and Maggie both react to this bit of close contact as they ba the eagle. It's getting warmer in here. Gabe reaches down yanks off the patch. The eagle thrashes as Gabe cleans th wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got some fight in her -- that's good. (beat) What happened to Dave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual. Flew off -- never calls, never writes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe winces at this one as he carefully tapes the small p and sticks it on the eagle's side. Maggie puts the eagle in the cage and closes the top door. Gabe and Maggie don' move any further apart as they pull their gloves off. Gab tentatively reaches for Maggie's face -- but she pushes h hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad to see you, Gabe. But I kind of wish you hadn't come. I was almost used to you being gone. (beat, quiet) Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pauses) I thought I came back to see if I'd learned to live with it. Well, big surprise. Coming back just tore me open all over again, like it all happened yesterday instead of a year ago. Nothing's changed. Including the way I feel about you. (beat) I didn't realize it till I saw you at the airport. But I came back for you, Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean you're going to stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not here. (beat) I want you come with me. Start over, somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You come back after being gone a year, and you expect me to -- (beat) You don't live here any more, Gabe. Your choice, remember? But this is my home. I'm not leaving. You can stay with me, or you can go alone. It's still your choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's an easy call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the shed's doorway is Hal. Stone faced. Grim.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE SHED
dialogues.text: Furious, Gabe heads out after Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I need your help. A plane's gone down on Comb Bluff. This storm would blow a copter all over the place -- but we can climb up to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We"? (beat) Talk to somebody who's still on the payroll. You've got a half dozen new guys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- who couldn't climb that wall now if there were stairs cut into it. But you've soloed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the summer. On a bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a little more important than a bet. Just a few injured people with no first aid or shelter, camping in a zero degree blizzard. They'll be ice sculptures by tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Maybe you missed the headlines -- but I don't do rescues any more. They're bad for my conscience. (beat) Fuck this one up on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe walks past Hal. Furious, Hal spins Gabe around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play it again, Gabe, about how we killed her. I was there too, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hot) Not like I was, pal -- her fingers brushed mine on the way down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right back) -- and I was the one who had to deal with her family when you fucking tore out of town. (takes a breath) We lost her. Whatever anybody says about cold stress and the clip, you and I have to live with that. But right now, there are some more people who need our help, and they shouldn't die too just because you've got a problem keeping the past in the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe knows he's right. But he's hesitant. And scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want the responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk away and you are responsible. They'll die. I can't do this alone. (Gabe slows but doesn't stop) You know what else, Gabe? You can go anywhere you want, but if you don't do this, now, you're going to be stuck on that goddamn ledge for the rest of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe turns. Sees Maggie in the doorway. She's heard every word. Gabe turns to Hal -- hesitates -- and nods.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Relative to the other mountains, Comb Bluff is smaller -- about 2,500 feet high. But that's like saying the Empire Building is smaller than the Sears Tower. It's still a lo way up if you're climbing the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: with full packs of mountaineering gear on. They've got to climb up this beast. Gabe -- now back in his orange Sheri jacket -- scrambles with Hal up the base of the mountain, last few yards before it turns into a sloping wall. Gabe takes a bolt gun -- which fires rope-fastened bolts into rock -- and hangs it from a strap on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating gun) That thing's dead weight. Completely useless for an ice climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just backup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe readies a coil of rope and starts up the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not a challenge) I'll lead. I left a few bolts last time I climbed this -- I think I can find some of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal starts up after Gabe, easily keeping pace with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save the rope for when it gets tough. (beat, realizing) That bet was for you to free climb the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (further up) Tell you what, Hal -- if we're still alive tomorrow morning, I'll give you the twenty bucks back, okay?

dialogues.speaker: COMB BLUFF
dialogues.text: Two orange specks move their way up the mountain -- it's definitely going to be a long trip.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: are now visibly two-thirds of the way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is not only higher, it's a lot tougher to climb. Instead being angular, the wall is now completely vertical -- and coated with ice. Rough, irregular ice ledges are all Gabe Hal can grip -- it's a matter of grabbing what you can fo handhold, and kicking the spikes of the steel crampons on their boots into the ice for footholds. Gabe leads, plant pitons into the ice, threading the rope through them as h goes. Three steel pins between Gabe and Hal. Their only s net. Gabe, trailing rope behind him, goes up a difficult of ice and climbs under a ledge, where he anchors the rop the ice with another piton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting down) Anchored!

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: is beside and slightly below Gabe -- at the other end of fifty foot rope. Hal cautiously pulls himself along the l to the first piton -- as is standard for a climb, he pull the piton, then moves on to the second -- but up above

dialogues.speaker: HIGHER ON THE MOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: Ice, building in a small crevase, builds and CRACKS the adjoining rock -- several ten-pound boulders fall, causin chain reaction

dialogues.speaker: ROCKSLIDE
dialogues.text: that bounces down the wall --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: hugs the ice wall, making himself as flat as possible --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting down) Rockslide!

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: flattens too as rocks bounce past -- the second anchoring piton LOOSENS as it is struck by a falling rock -- Hal nervously eyes the last piton between him and Gabe --

dialogues.speaker: THE PITON
dialogues.text: also has been clipped by the still falling boulders and d at half mast -- no way are these going to hold in the unreliable ice --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: tries to stay flat, but one boulder painfully CLIPS him o shoulder, knocking him from his perch -- Hal falls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In falling, Hal's weight on the rope yanks out the neares anchor piton -- Hal tumbles in space, keeping pace with t boulders, as --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: who's seen everything we have, quickly reaches to the pit he's just anchored, and removes the carabiner clip --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: The rope draws taut, yanking out the last piton between h Gabe -- nothing but a few yards of slack rope now --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: has the bolt gun out. He rapidly hooks the rope's carabin clip to the chambered bolt, and FIRES it at a solid rock above him --

dialogues.speaker: THE BOLT
dialogues.text: imbeds solidly in the rock --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: lashes the rope to his shoulder, bracing for the coming i by lodging his feet in the ice --

dialogues.speaker: THE JOLT
dialogues.text: The line pulls taut, leaving Hal suspended, the wind knoc out of him from the impact --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: is almost dragged down by the jolt -- he painfully takes of the impact in his shoulders -- the shock forces his fe through an ice ledge -- but the rope, bolted to the rock above, has held. Barely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken, voice gone) Anchored -- (shouts this time) Anchored!

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: now somewhat recovered, steadies himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless too) You're sure this time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal climbs up the rope, finally reaching another ledge slightly below Gabe's. Hal leans against the wall, gaspin Gabe clips the gun to his pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up at gun) Don't say it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wheezing too) It's kind of hard to resist -- GABE                         HAL It's not dead                It's not dead weight -- you                weight -- I am. are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal and Gabe start howling -- that hysterical, giddy laug that only comes from just missing a violent end.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: Hal and Gabe's friendship is starting to resurface -- the LAUGHTER is nearly louder than the wind, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the top of the bluff, someone is looking down throug binoculars -- Gabe and Hal's orange jackets are plainly visible a few hundred yards below.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: lowers the binoculars, and keys an ear button on the head radio he's wearing, sending a beep.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PLANE
dialogues.text: Travers is wearing another headset -- the others are just resting in the seats

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mouthpiece) Have they arrived? (two beeps in response) Good. Return to the plane and cover your tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to others) Get ready.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOUNTAIN BELOW
dialogues.text: Hal and Gabe are tired, but get a second wind from the excitement of being almost on top. Gabe stops, breathless a second, then goes on. Hal lags a little behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- the hard part's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe heads up and over

dialogues.speaker: THE MOUNTAIN'S EDGE/CRASH SITE
dialogues.text: and helps Hal up. From here, the rest of the range looms large. Even in the continuing snowstorm, it's a spectacul sight -- but Gabe and Hal don't pause to enjoy it. This i a trip for sport. Hal looks off into the trees, and sees torn tree stumps from the plane crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim) That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal and Gabe run into the wooded area and follow the wreckage -- felled trees, a smashed wing -- and reach

dialogues.speaker: THE FUSELAGE
dialogues.text: which sits intact by the other edge of the precipice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the fuselage was broken. That looks pretty cozy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled too) The pilot was hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this look like a prank to you? Come on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal pulls open the passenger door and goes in -- Gabe, wa takes a look around the plane.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE FUSELAGE
dialogues.text: It's comparatively dark in here -- Hal starts in, shining light -- the beam finds

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: slumped down on the cabin floor, a blanket wrapped around him -- he's shaking and is generally giving a good impres of a shock victim. Hal rushes to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax -- we're here to help --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Weak", Travers whispers as Hal gives him some water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to talk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers won't quit -- Hal leans down to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse whisper) Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Where? What are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gun barrel moves INTO VIEW as it presses against Hal's Heldon and Ryan are right behind him. Travers instantly d his act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said "we". Where are the rest?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: notes footprints in the snow -- fresh ones -- and kneels to look at the cable wrapped around the tree. No ordinary accident. But before he can think about this, he gets an earful of gun barrel from Qualen, who is behind him.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE FUSELAGE
dialogues.text: Qualen hustles Gabe inside the plane -- his hands are on head, and his pack has been removed. Qualen throws the pa to Ryan and Delmer, who rifle through it, removing anythi that could be a weapon -- they quickly confiscate Gabe's gun and ice axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's for dinner? (Kynette tosses packet) Ugh. "Dried Beef Slices With Barbeque Sauce." (tosses it back) Try and make this edible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis looks at Hal's park ranger badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal Tucker. (to Gabe) Where's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have one. Just a wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen tosses it to Travers, who glances through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe Walker... (notes photo of Maggie) Very attractive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. Let me tell you what's on for today. We'd like you to help settle a wager. You see, we lost some luggage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers motions to Ryan and Qualen, who shove Gabe and Ha forward in the cabin. Travers takes out the tracer monito

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing them the blips) See these? Now I've bet the gentlemen behind you that you know enough about this mountain range to lead us to each of these, quickly, and that you'd be happy to do so. They bet me you couldn't and wouldn't. (guns are clicked) Now tell me -- who wins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe and Hal eye each other -- no choice. Gabe nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good dog. Now let's get this expedition started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal and Gabe lead the "expedition" down a steep, but pass descent, leading to --

dialogues.speaker: A NATURAL STONE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: that links Comb Bluff with the next mountain. Travers sto Gabe and pulls out the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Connect the dots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe pauses as he holds the monitor up against the mountainscape.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAIN AND MONITOR
dialogues.text: The first blip is up a thousand feet -- it's a wall, and obviously not something for a novice. Gabe pauses a littl too long -- Qualen nudges him with his gun. Gabe hands th monitor back to Travers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe, with Hal right behind, leads them up the wall -- it not a straight climb, but there's a series of zig-zagging natural ledges that cut up the wall. Wide enough even for amateur. The others follow Gabe and Hal's example.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: have led the gang further up the wall, using pitons and carabiner clips to create a guide rope. It's still just a matter of climbing relatively easy ascending ledges. Hal Gabe lead them by jumping to the next ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gabe hammers in a new piton, he turns to Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) We don't have to do this. We know these mountains -- they don't. If we can get ahead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you climb faster than they can shoot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to try something. Think we'll get a finder's fee after they get all their "luggage"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. All the bullets we can eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what really worries me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something else to worry about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Once they've got what they're after -- they're gonna need a copter to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe nods grimly -- and keeps moving up. The rest keep pa

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL
dialogues.text: The climbers have reached a point of comparative comfort the wall -- the ledge is now two feet wide. Travers takes the tracer monitor -- the monitor shows that the first ca just above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it. (beat)                       It's up there.

dialogues.speaker: "UP THERE"
dialogues.text: juts out of the wall fifty feet above their position. As rest of the wall above is completely sheer, it's obvious the case, if it is above, has landed on top of a ledge. But this isn't easily accessible -- we MOVE DOWN from the overhang and can see there are only the smallest of handh to get up there, and those are slick with ice and snow. W the rest of the mountain bulges outward in a curve, makin climbing almost impossible.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LEDGE
dialogues.text: Travers holds his gun on Gabe, and motions up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fetch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need the ice axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) You've got to be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Okay. How about some tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers nods -- Kynette pulls a roll of tape out of Gabe' confiscated pack and throws it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crampons too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers hesitates, but nods -- Kynette throws him the iro spikes. Gabe fastens them to his boots. Gabe looks up -- this is going to be tough, even for him. spite of the cold, he takes off his gloves -- that's how these holds are -- and he meticulously tapes up his hands his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: moves up the wall with some ease at first -- there are hand-sized handholds, and decent footholds -- but twenty up, there's nothing. To keep going, Gabe has to painfully wedge his fingers into small cracks, essentially supporti his weight only by several fingerholds at any given momen We can see from the angle that Gabe is at least 3,000 fee from solid ground. We can see from his face that he's try not to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LEDGE
dialogues.text: watch Gabe's slow progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating wall) Where could he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather he didn't show us. (beat) We don't need two guides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) You win. Kill him when he gets down.

dialogues.speaker: GABE ON THE WALL
dialogues.text: Make that "if he comes down". Gabe is now in one of the worst positions possible for a free climb. He is moving u the underside of the overhang and is essentially hanging upside down, knifing his fingers into tiny cracks for sup It's excruciating -- both in terms of muscular effort, an abrasions that come from forcing fingers into ice and roc again and again. Gabe keeps his hold with one hand and sl the other up, hammering it into a crack wedge with ice -- some of the ice chips whistle past and down -- -- finally, Gabe gropes one hand over the edge, and pulls himself onto

dialogues.speaker: THE OVERHANG
dialogues.text: Exhausted, Gabe pulls himself prone across the top. Somet hard is underneath him -- Gabe recovers and brushes the s off the money case that's underneath. It's battered from fall, but is still barely holding together. Gabe manages force open the trashed locks -- he looks inside the case, fingers a band of $5000s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LEDGE
dialogues.text: look up. They can see Gabe has made it -- but they can't him, or the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient, shouting) Lower it down -- now!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OVERHANG
dialogues.text: has no intention of doing this -- he snaps the case shut looks over at a ledge that moves off from it -- and at th and snow above.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LEDGE
dialogues.text: try to look up and locate Gabe. They can't. Until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting down) I've got a better idea. Why don't you come up and get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the case, Gabe moves, back against the wall, on a le that skirts off the overhand -- from Travers and Qualen's point of view. Gabe can hardly be seen -- since the mount bulges out as it goes up. Gabe's got a slight edge of cov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts to Heldon) Get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heldon runs along the lower ledge, FIRING up at --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: who has to flatten against the upper ledge -- bullets how past at twenty per second, SPARKING against the lip of th rock -- it's cover, but not much --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: looks up, worried --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: piled by the ton from the storm, lie further above -- the holding it back already, already weakened by the sun, is chiselled away by bullets --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LOWER LEDGE
dialogues.text: grabs Hal and puts the gun to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Bring the money down, or we kill your friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers pushes the barrel away from Hal, shaking his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't. (frowning) And he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe moves across his thing ledge as Heldon runs across h Gabe ducks back and has to flatten even more against the because his ledge is getting smaller --

dialogues.speaker: HELDON
dialogues.text: smiles, seeing Gabe's cover is gone -- Heldon's ledge is getting wider, so it's easier for him to fire up. Heldon out to the edge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's now nothing between Heldon and Gabe -- Heldon tak dead aim --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: looks up, sweating it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on --

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE AND SNOW
dialogues.text: above finally give way, dropping an avalanche on

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: who drops the case and hugs the wall --

dialogues.speaker: THE AVALANCHE
dialogues.text: Only now can we see how much snow and ice had been penned on the mountain top -- tons of ice and snow sweep down th mountainside -- it SHATTERS the case against the wall as easily swipes a SCREAMING Heldon off the ledge --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS, QUALEN AND HAL
dialogues.text: are safe at their vantage, but stunned at the sight of --

dialogues.speaker: THE AVALANCHE
dialogues.text: Heldon's machine fun FIRES uselessly as he's swallowed in explosion of white -- as well as a flurry of green as the bills scatter amid the snow -- -- then: quiet. The avalanche ends as abruptly as it star The rumble dies down to complete silence.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: apoplectic, stares at seventeen million dollars worth of settling far below. He takes his gun, furious, and fires

dialogues.speaker: THE UPPER LEDGE
dialogues.text: where Gabe was hugging the wall -- it's now blanketed wit snow. Travers FIRES an entire clip at where Gabe used to The snow FALLS AWAY, revealing nothing but stark rock. Ga has been swept away.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: reacts and attacks Travers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers turns and pins Hal against the wall with the gun, ready to kill him too. But he's stopped by Qualen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We need him to get the rest of the money. (he isn't backing down) If he dies we lose everything

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers, furious, takes the gun out of Hal's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hal) Get us out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal stares at Travers with absolute fury -- but he leads gang back along the ledge in retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powdery snow is settling from the avalanche. From a cave the rocks, Brett and Evan crawl out a little timidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan takes a pair of overpriced binoculars and looks up -

dialogues.speaker: FAR UP ON LEDGE
dialogues.text: The figures are small, but it's clear that one is pointin gun at an orange-jacketed figure.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: lowers the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brett -- you're not going to believe this -- but a couple of guys are holding a gun on Hal and forcing him up the bluff --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan turns to

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: who has found both Heldon's broken body, and his gun, hal buried in snow. Evan walks over, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brett picks up the gun -- this is more an adventure than ever dreamed of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's catch up and find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brett and Evan grab their packs, and hurry onto a trail, return to --

dialogues.speaker: THE UPPER LEDGE
dialogues.text: where Gabe was. Nothing is stirring. Until, there's some movement ten feet from where Gabe was hugging the wall. It's a crevice in the mountain, about two feet wide -- a climber would call this a "chimney" -- and it's packed wi ice and snow. It's also packed with

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: -- his hand gropes out -- and with some difficulty, he di himself out, gasping and coughing. Gabe, coated with snow leans against the wall and rests. Alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie is on the phone, pacing, as Frank is slumped in fr of the radio scanner. Suddenly, the radio comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Come in, Rescue Unit -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie bolts over to the radio before Frank can react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keying mike) Rescue Unit -- what's going on, Hall? -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers has his gun pressed to Hal's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No tricks, no procedural codes, no personal messages -- just tell them everything's under control and you're taking care of the wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys it) We've reached the wreckage -- top of Comb Bluff -- six injured, but they're responding to treatment. Everything A-OK. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything isn't okay, Hal -- I'm coming up after you -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, Maggie. Winds are too high, and the passengers' injuries are all superficial. We're going to ride out the storm here -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers yanks away the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have her come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it -- downdrafts would wipe her all over the peaks -- (Travers starts to argue) -- Not that I expect you to give a shit, but it's our only copter. You'll be stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers relents and hands the radio back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle the winds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking in) Forget about it, Maggie, that's an order -- acknowledge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie looks out the window. The station's windspeed gaug flying around so fast it looks like it might take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acknowledged. Let me talk to Gabe -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates) You can't. He's taking care of passengers. Just like I should be. Over and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie leans back in the chair, looks out at the storm, a tries not to worry. She fails miserably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snatching radio away) Good. You might live longer than your friend. Now -- (takes out monitor) -- what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal takes the monitor -- the next blip is above, almost straight up. Hal motions to the wooded area ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
