dialogues.text: The next one's on top of the peak. This'll be long, but easy -- more like a hike than a climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious) It looks like a winding route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a more direct route. The East Face. But it's the wall on the other side, and it's smooth as glass. Maybe a dozen guys in the world could do it in good weather. Only a psycho would try it in a snowstorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers digests this, and motions Hal to move on as we --

dialogues.speaker: GABE'S FACE
dialogues.text: is torn in pain. In spite of the cold and wind, he's dren in sweat, half exertion, half fear. We pull back to take

dialogues.speaker: THE EAST WALL
dialogues.text: Envision a wall. A really big wall. A really, really big A wall that's as wide as it is high -- five thousand feet five thousand feet -- narrowing to a domed peak at the su Now picture the same wall, checkered with ice. If this we horizontal, you or I couldn't walk on it without falling. Now picture the same wall with an orange dot, two-thirds the way up it. The orange dot is

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: and he barely has the strength to hold on, much less go u Gabe holds himself steady with one hand, gets a foothold, swings another hand up to SLAM it against the wall. He's improvised gear -- he's tied a crampon to one hand. it's as awkward as it sounds. Gabe moves up only a foot o -- then pulls out the crampon, reaches up, and SLAMS it i the wall, starting the painful process over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wright's pacing around, trying to figure out what in his office he should break first. Davis shows up at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) Okay -- I know it's not in San Francisco. I know it's not here. I know it's not in any fucking airport from here to Montana. Where it's not - we got that covered. Now, do you have any ideas on where it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking to a map) There's no radio contact, sir. At all. We're not receiving the tracer signal from the cockpit's flight recorder. Radar lost it after it went low here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to a huge part of Colorado. Hundreds of square miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to assume it went down in the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air search?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head) That storm hasn't quit yet. Weather service says we've got it until tomorrow morning at least. Even if we could get a plane up now, it'd be impossible to see anything on the ground. And --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wright slumps into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The roads are shut down, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of this area doesn't even have roads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubs his eyes) Keep two copters on full standby. And let me know the second that storm starts to wind down.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: is clearly exhausted and freezing -- his lips are blue, h eyebrows encrusted with snow. Wind still threatens to kno him off the wall -- but he forces himself on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teeth chattering) A steambath. (spikes himself up) A steambath -- and a bottle of whiskey. (new foothold) A steambath with a bottle of Glenlivet. And a fire. (new handhold) A steambath -- with a bottle of Glenlivet -- and a steak. (new foothold) A steak soaked with Glenlivet, cooking over a steambath on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe finally reaches the top of the wall, where it meets enormous overhang of ice.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: is right underneath where the ice flows over the wall. Ga takes his handheld crampon and hammers it into the ice overhead with more force than usual. This one is going to to hold. Gabe steels himself for a tough move -- with one hand gri that crampon, he swings out, away from the wall. Only the crampon spikes jammed into the ice above his han are keeping Gabe from falling. Gabe needs the second cram to make the move up -- but that's not going to be easy to It's attached to his boot. As Gabe clings to the upper crampon, his body swaying, he reaches down with his free hand to loosen the other cramp

dialogues.speaker: DOWN
dialogues.text: The ground is one slip and five thousand feet away. Gabe fumbles desperately with the buckles on the crampons -- b both his fingers, and the buckles, are frozen stiff --

dialogues.speaker: GABE'S FACE
dialogues.text: shows real, solid terror for the first time --

dialogues.speaker: DOWN
dialogues.text: Gabe gets the first buckle off -- then the second. The cr is off his boot.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: still swinging from one hand, takes the now-freed crampon slams it into the ice. It doesn't hold -- but the force o Gabe's swing, pushing him away, has loosened the other crampon. Gabe only gets one more shot at this -- he swing the free crampon up with all his might -- it catches in t same split second as the other dislodges. But the hard part is over -- with the two crayons, Gabe quickly manages to climb up over the lip of

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE OVERHANG
dialogues.text: This is a field of ice sloping up to the top. Gabe pulls himself a few feet away from the edge, and puts the cramp back on his feet where they belong. It's now pretty simpl Gabe to run up the ice slope three hundred yards to

dialogues.speaker: THE SUMMIT
dialogues.text: which is a rocky, wooded area. Gabe seems to have a secon wind now -- he runs to the other side of the summit. The side is obviously the route Hal and the others will be taking -- beneath the summit is a winding, well-beaten pa Gabe finally arrives at a small shack with a sign nearby commemorating the "DOUGLAS EXPEDITION - 1933".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is just a small "point of interest" shed for hardy touris who have hiked up this far -- there is a corny photo stan where you stick your head through a hole, so your face is on top of a cartoon climber hacking up a mountain. Gabe r past this to a glass display case on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: THE GORDON DOUGLAS DISPLAY
dialogues.text: has black and white photos of a square jawed 1930s climbe with his expedition -- more important is what's beneath i Douglas' original climbing equipment -- a coil of rope, s pitons, a hat, a cloth backpack, small binoculars, other and ends. Gabe prepares to smash the glass -- and hesitat Respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing) Sorry, Gordon -- I promise I'll have it back tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe SMASHES the glass as we move to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is leading Qualen, Travers and the others upward -- t is a comparatively easy route, but still tiring. The sun down beyond a facing, taller mountain. Ryan is huffing an puffing -- the altitude and exertion are getting to him. allows himself a smile at his discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- tourists take this trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen pokes Hal with the gun -- he moves on ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting dark rapidly -- Gabe has scaled a rock forma so he has a view of the rest of the summit --

dialogues.speaker: SCANNING THE TREELINE
dialogues.text: Gabe slowly looks along the trees of the summit -- looks pretty ordinary to us, but something must have caught Gab eye, because he swings back to look at one tree. With bro branches on top.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: climbs down from his rock perch and rushes toward the tre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This "expedition" reaches the top -- Hal is in the lead, Qualen just inches behind. Qualen shoves Hal forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers takes out the tracer and starts following the bli

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE ON THE SUMMIT
dialogues.text: frantically rushes around, looking for the case -- he spo crater of snow, rushes to it and starts digging. Even bel the snow, the tracer's blinking red light is glowing and visible. Gabe laughs as he digs it out.

dialogues.speaker: NEARBY ON THE SUMMIT
dialogues.text: has his eyes glued to the tracer monitor, which shows the is nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen shines a light -- all of them push their way throu the trees.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: is excited now -- he can't even wait for Qualen's flashli he intuitively races through the trees, dividing his atte between his surroundings and

dialogues.speaker: THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: which shows he's practically on top of the case -- finall

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: shoves his way through some small pines -- he can see the blinking of the red tracer light ahead through the branch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling behind) It's over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers shoves his way through the branches, and heads fo light -- but something's wrong -- Qualen comes up behind Travers and shines the light on

dialogues.speaker: A SNOWMAN
dialogues.text: cute, if hastily constructed, stands with a five-pebble s as well as Douglas' cap, in a clearing. The still blinkin still operable tracer is now the nose of the snowman. The is leaned up against it. Travers runs over to the case, furious, and opens it. It' empty -- except for a single $5000 bill. Travers picks it up -- scrawled on the margin is "LET'S TRADE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) He's still alive. (furious) He's still alive! (to Qualen and the others) He can't be far away -- spread out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen, Kynette, Delmer and Krystel fan out into the wood each with a flashlight and a fun. Ryan, however, straps o nightfinder goggles and runs out without a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hal, brandishing gun) Put your hands on your head.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE ON THE SUMMIT
dialogues.text: watches the chaos with a grin from a slightly elevated va point -- he can see the flashlight beams, all headed in t wrong direction. But he doesn't see

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: With these goggles, light is amplified a thousandfold -- isn't one of those infra-red, thermo-blob jobs -- it look more like day for night photography. Even starlight is en for Ryan to run easily through the thick woods -- and he' going in the right direction.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: begins climbing down to level ground so he can circle clo to where Travers is holding Hal -- before he can get far

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: looks up, and can clearly see Gabe climbing down the smal rock, twenty yards distant --

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: smiles, looking macabre under the goggles, and opens fire

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: is startled as the bullets impact inches over his head -- jumps the last ten feet to the ground and is running even he hits the ground -- more bullets hit where Gabe was a split second ago --

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: chases Gabe, easily maneuvering through the trees --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: runs too, trying to dodge Ryan's continuing fusillades -- knows this territory, but to him, it's still pitch dark - stumbles, and rams against trees --

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: keeps coming up behind, closing the hap, Gabe's bright fo just ahead --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: comes out of the trees and finds he is on another part of summit. All that's beneath him is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a sudden, sloping plunge down a field of ice. No escap route here -- anything that goes down this slide is going the way to the ground far below.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: is driven forward by a fresh burst of bullets -- he dives the edge of the ice field and ducks behind a boulder -- t sole source of cover.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE ON THE SUMMIT
dialogues.text: Kristel, Qualen and Kynette, having heard the gunshots, a now rushing to Gabe's position --

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: almost casually emerges from the woods. He can see there nowhere for Gabe to have gone -- except behind the boulde walks toward it as if he had all the time in the world.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: fumbles in his backpack and pulls out something from the Douglas exhibit -- an ancient flare that looks like a can sterno. Gabe pulls out his lighter and tries to light it resists and looks like a dud, but finally it catches, and it ignites Gabe heaves it over the boulder at Ryan --

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: arcs over the boulder to fully ignite, turning everything into a blinding, agonizing flash of white --

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: SCREAMS, putting one hand over the goggles, trying to rip off --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: bolts out from behind the boulder to rush him --

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: instantly aware of what Gabe's doing, blindly shoots, fan out in a semi-circle as he gets the goggles off --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: just runs straight ahead to Ryan, getting to him before t machine gun field of fire can intersect his path -- Gabe tackles Ryan as he manages to get the goggles off -- both fall to the ground, and -- The machine gun CLATTERS away, landing on the edge of the just out of reach -- Ryan, now recovered from the blindin flash, pulls an ice axe out of a pack sheath and swings i Gabe -- Gabe rolls away in time, and gets to the machine grabbing it -- But Ryan dives for Gabe, slamming into him the force of it knocks the machine gun loose -- it skips the ice slope -- but the momentum of Ryan's hit also carr both Gabe and Ryan over the edge, onto --

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE SLOPE
dialogues.text: Gabe and Ryan both tumble over the edge and start sliding down, Ryan face first on his stomach, Gabe head first and his back -- both are in immediate agony, because

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE
dialogues.text: -- it's covered with razor sharp, irregular ridges, both and small, that slice through clothing and shred skin as pick up speed --

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE FIELD
dialogues.text: The edge and a five thousand foot drop are less than a hu yards away --

dialogues.speaker: GABE AND RYAN SLIDING
dialogues.text: Ryan flails and SCREAMS as the ice gashes him from underneath -- Gabe, however, manages to flip over and to side -- he lunges on top of Ryan and rides him down like bobsled --

dialogues.speaker: END OF THE ICE SLOPS
dialogues.text: is coming up too fast --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: tries to maintain his perch on Ryan, who is SCREAMING and yet used to the idea of being a human sled -- he isn't remaining still enough to provide a smooth ride -- Gabe frantically reaches behind to Ryan's wrist to get the ice trailing from a wrist strap, but Ryan's arm is thrashing threatening to toss off the axe --

dialogues.speaker: ON SUMMIT
dialogues.text: Qualen, Kristel and Kynette arrive at the lip, and look d incredulous --

dialogues.speaker: GABE RIDING RYAN
dialogues.text: Gabe and Ryan, accelerating, have almost reached the edge

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: finally grabs the ice axe, pulling it off Ryan's wrist -- as they reach the precipice edge, Gabe loops the axe to h wrist and swings toward the ice with everything he's got The axe's scythe-like blade catches on the ice, right at lip of the precipice -- Gabe is wrenched to a painful hal suspended over the drop, as what's left of Ryan, still SCREAMING, shoots over the edge -- Gabe unhooks the axe, and gets another handhold. Gabe use axe to climb further down the ice to some rock -- finding easier hand holds, he quickly disappears into the darknes

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN, KRISTEL AND KYNETTE
dialogues.text: look down -- Ryan's death scream is still echoing. Qualen furious -- Gabe has escaped with the second case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kynette) Follow him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kynette shines his flashlight below, illuminating the lon frozen streak of blood on the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures with light) After you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The expedition has holed up here for the night -- Travers Qualen look upset. Things aren't going as well as they'd hoped. Kristel tries to get some candy out of a vending machine that's obviously empty. Kynette saws at some camp with a distinctive knife -- the handle is a set of brass knuckles. Delmer guards Hal, who is bound, and seated by souvenir photo stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- look at the bright side. (beat) At least you've only got to make the split five ways now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe confidently drops down onto a large ledge that juts from the wall -- obviously familiar territory for him. Th ledge leads to a small, enclosed cave. Gabe takes out his penlight and shines it -- but the light looks dim. Batter are low. Gabe pockets it, flicks his lighter and goes in

dialogues.speaker: THE CAVE
dialogues.text: in the flickering light, we can see that no one has been here for a while -- snow, dust, rocks -- but we should al recognize this from the photo seen earlier as Gabe, Maggi Hal's hangout.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: smiles with the memories -- then his face brightens with memory in particular. Gabe rushes to a corner of the cave opens a rock-lid to a hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please still be there -- oh, please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe reaches in the stash and finds an ancient half-full of Jack Daniels. The first thing to go right all day. Gab uncaps it and gratefully gulps down a double shot. Peace, last. Gabe smiles and leans against the wall, closing his -- but he's startled instantly by a SCREECH -- Gabe's eye shoot open -- An aggressive rat scurries toward him on the floor. Gabe grabs a rock and CLOBBERS the rat off-screen, ending screeches with one blow. Gabe's face first registers disgust -- then an idea. Then real disgust. Sighing, Gabe pulls out a pocket knife and opens the blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe takes the now cooked rat carcass -- properly skinned butchered -- off his knife blade. We can see from flicker shadows that a small fire is now burning in a cave -- we pull back to see

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRE
dialogues.text: which is built out of small bundles of $5,000 bills. It's to say that something like $500,000 is going up in smoke, the fire's dying down. Gabe tosses a fresh band of bills the flame. Gabe cools the knife in some snow, saws off a leg, and chews unhappily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Mmm. Just like -- chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe sparingly washes the bite down with a taste of Jack Daniel. It's going to have to last him. He has an entire to get through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rays of the sun start to poke through the mount It's stopped snowing -- the storm seems to be letting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very quiet in here. Frank is snoring, slumped over the ra Maggie is wide awake and obviously hasn't slept -- her attention is fixed out the window.

dialogues.speaker: WINDSPEED GAUGE
dialogues.text: The gauge is still flying around, but clearly shows that winds are slowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wright is coiled at his desk, tense. Ten empty styrofoam coffee cups -- and dark rings under Wright's eyes -- make clear he hasn't slept. Wright's assistant bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a fix on the plane, sir -- we're getting a reading on the flight recorder tracer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any visual? Any radio contact?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading to the door) Get the copters ready. We take off in three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The winds are still too strong --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to hear it. We're still going. The plane might be intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wright drags the protesting Davis out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. That fifty million isn't coming out of my pension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers, Qualen and the rest of the expedition head out o shack, a little groggy. Odds are no one got much sleep. Travers shoves Hal toward a sketchy "YOU ARE HERE" map of mountain range, and hands him the tracer monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still interested in staying alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal matches the monitor to the map -- the blip is higher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to map) It's up here. Somewhere on the Tower. There's a way to cross over to the top in about half a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers shoves Hal forward -- the others follow.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE ON THE MOUNTAIN/SUMMIT
dialogues.text: From about fifty yards off, someone watches Hal lead the away from the shack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're heading toward the opposite edge. An easy way down.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT AND EVAN
dialogues.text: are crouched in the woods. Brett, gun in hand, has no ide far out of his league he is. Evan looks like he's having second thoughts, but he can't hack down now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll cut around this side, and wind up in front. You come up behind them -- quietly. And we've got 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brett -- they've got five guns --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can collect them all after I get the drop on 'em. Let's get moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brett, automatic held high, circles off through the woods Evan reluctantly lopes off toward his assignment.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: Gabe pulls his jacket on -- reversed, with the grey linin out, so the orange won't make him so easy to spot -- and starts out towards the facing Tower -- his route, clearly going to be along the rock wall. It's relatively sheer, b there are shelves cut into it to make walking easy.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAIN TOP/SUMMIT
dialogues.text: races quietly through the woods in a parallel path with H who's guiding the hang. Brett circles around ahead of the waiting. Before he can jump out --

dialogues.speaker: ON BRETT
dialogues.text: hiding ahead in the trees and rocks.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: makes eye contact with Brett, realizes what he's doing, a shakes his head as violently as he dares -- no, don't --

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: gives Hal a confident wink in response, then pounces in f of the gang, gun held high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers, Delmer, Kristel and Kynette are startled, but do immediately comply. This throws Brett off his stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous now) You heard me! Drop the guns!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers smiles and steps closer to Brett. The others walk in front of Hal. Travers actually laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "End of the line"? That's classic. (beat) You've got style. So, I'm going to give you a three-count to figure out how to turn the safety off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brett doesn't even look down -- he responds by FIRING a s burst over Travers' head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice try. I've got one of these at home. Now drop 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All drop their guns -- Brett, unfortunately, realizes at same time we do --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- where's the other guy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Brett, behind you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late -- Brett can only twist around half way before -

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN
dialogues.text: easily mows down Brett with his machine gun, riddling him at least thirty rounds at close range. Brett falls dead i the snow. Qualen walks up to Brett's corpse, blood steami the reddening snow, and kicks it over.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW ON THE WALLSIDE
dialogues.text: Gabe, reacting to the sound of the machine gun fire, clim up, but there's nothing he can do --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS AND QUALEN
dialogues.text: and the others pick up their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to face Hal) Time to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers sees that Hal is gone -- he's escaped in the confusion.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WOODS
dialogues.text: runs like his ass is on fire and practically collides wit Evan, who is more panicked than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came up here to jump the spur -- (pulls Evan's chute out of his pack) This'd be a great time to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quick) Listen -- they don't know you're up here -- I'll draw their fire, you've got to make the jump and get help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't -- I -- uh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated, grabs chute) Unless you want to do it the other way around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan snatches the parachute and runs off. Hal, wasting no time, runs in the opposite direction, deliberately making much noise as he can, slapping branches, stomping on rock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: runs into the woods -- Qualen and Kristel, hearing Hal's retreat, run after him.  But Travers stops for a second - has spotted

dialogues.speaker: EVAN'S FOOTPRINTS
dialogues.text: in the snow -- not unlike a neon arrow.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: runs in the direction of the footprints and quickly close gap between him and

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: who tries to pull on the chute and run at the same time - it's not easy. Evan closes one of the three buckles -- bu

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: bursts out of the woods and runs up right behind him --

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN AND KRISTEL
dialogues.text: in the meantime, get behind Hal in a clearing -- Kristel over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, caught again, freezes in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: is still up and running -- he dodges Travers' fire, weavi through trees, getting the second buckle closed -- he see edge, just ahead, and puts on an extra burst of speed --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: does likewise, still firing -- his clip runs out, but thi only buys Evan an extra few seconds --

dialogues.speaker: THE SPUR
dialogues.text: is a rock formation that just out like a diving board -- runs like hell to the edge of it --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: is right behind him, and has slapped a fresh clip in plac but before he can shoot --

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: dives off the edge and clasps the third buckle --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LEDGE
dialogues.text: is directly below a few hundred feet -- looking up, he th Evan has made it -- but

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SPUR EDGE
dialogues.text: throws himself down, aims quickly but carefully, and FIRE twenty rounds towards Evan's falling figure --

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Evan LAUGHS -- he hasn't been hit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- wait till you're out of range -- don't pull it yet --

dialogues.speaker: EVAN FALLING
dialogues.text: Several seconds pass -- Evan is now several hundred feet and apparently out of firing range --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: stops firing -- but doesn't seem unhappy at all.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: LAUGHS more and pulls the D-ring -- the parachute billows open, inflating --

dialogues.speaker: THE PARACHUTE
dialogues.text: which has been shredded by bullets that hit the pack -- a quickly as it inflates, it deflates through dozens of holes -- whatever resistance is left vanishes as the cano collapses.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN'S
dialogues.text: exhilaration turns to panic as he frantically pulls on th chute's guide lines -- but the more he does this, the fas the chute caves in -- he SCREAMS as the chute finally giv way and plummets right past

dialogues.speaker: GABE ON THE LEDGE
dialogues.text: who is powerless to do anything but watch --

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: falls the long, full five thousand feet, desperately, uselessly, pulling in the lines of the tattered chute unt he's tangled in it like a shroud --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: turns away -- he can't watch Evan hit bottom -- he grimac and looks up with absolute hate at

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: who doesn't see Gabe -- he's laughing at Evan's desperati which ends as his death scream is cut off. Hal is led over to the spur, with the other gang members behind him. Hal looks as angry as Gabe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that Walker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No such luck. (to Hal, smiling) Cheer up. Everyone should die in a spot this beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LEDGE BELOW
dialogues.text: who has heard this and is shaking with fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Don't worry. You will.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: On top, Hal reluctantly leads the gang away -- below, we see Gabe start out on a parallel path along the ledges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winds or not, Maggie is untying the helicopter's rotor fr the bolts on the helipad. Frank, who has obviously just awakened, rushes out of the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie -- what are you doing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go nuts if I sit here one more hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still a little breezy out, Mag --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie gets into the helicopter and starts the rotor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over engine's whine) You coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank hesitates, but climbs in the other side. The helico lifts off and heads toward the mountain range.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The next obstacle Hal is leading the gang through is a buttress -- a large, stark boulder formation -- that lays between the mountain they've just come from, and the near mountain to it: the Tower. This is lower down from the summit -- it's solid and treeless. Hal and the rest of the expedition is totally exposed as climb in single file up to the top. Terrain is flat enoug that the climb amount to an uphill run on all fours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal leads the gang forward -- and keeps casting anxious glances back at them. And beyond them. Travers notices th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about it. He's smart, but he's not invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal looks back. Travers is right. There's absolutely no w Gabe can come up behind them without being seen.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER DOWN ON BLUFF
dialogues.text: where the bluff meets a tree-lined plain. Gabe, in hiding watches Hal and the others go up. No, he can't follow the the bluff's side without being seen. But Gabe moves close the bluff's base -- Gabe shoves through some trees to the beginning of

dialogues.speaker: THE "CHIMNEY"
dialogues.text: A crevice runs the entire length and breadth of the bluff

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: pulls out his ancient binoculars, and scans the crack.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHIMNEY
dialogues.text: Starting with an outside view, we can see that the crevic runs all the way up, and through, the bluff -- but it's a zig-zag, not a straight line. Picture a mine shaft designed by a madman. The crack move upward, then erratically to the side, then straight up ag The width of the crack is uneven, ranging from six inches six feet. And that's just how it looks on the outside. There's no telling what the interior is like. Gabe turns the binoculars to the inside of the crack. It' hard to see much -- it's very, very dark. But it looks as the crack goes all the way through the bluff, as well as the way up it. On this route, Gabe can tunnel through the mountain instead of going up the side.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: puts away the binoculars and wedges himself into the crac starting the long process of going up -- and through -- t mountain formation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frenzy of activity, as several dozen Treasury agents si through the snow for the wreckage of the CT-39, some taki photos, some taking videotapes, some putting the pieces i bags for analysis. Many bags. Many small bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Treasury plane has been completely pulverized by the and its subsequent explosion -- there are few pieces here aren't charred, and fewer still that are any larger than paperback book.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: unhappily walks through the carnage and past agents gathe up the plane, to a harried crash specialist from the FAA ROSS STUART (40s) -- who is organizing the debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can you confirm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir -- it crashed. That, I can confirm. (condescending) We've been here just about one hour. These events take months to analyze. So if you'll excuse me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks away -- but Wright, pissed, spins him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think I will. The reason the FAA pays you is to exercise your vast, amazing knowledge of these "events". So I expect you to come up with some stunning insights, something a slow-witted fuck like me hasn't already observed. (gesturing to wreckage) One: it didn't blow up in mid-air, because the debris isn't widely dispersed. But was there a bomb on board that could have disabled it? I wonder. (pointing back) Two: There wasn't an attempted landing. Otherwise, there'd be debris to the east of the wreckage, where the plane was coming from. Did it come straight down? That's got me scratching my head too. (gesturing back to wreckage) And three: the flight recorder's tracer led us here in the first place. So where is the goddamn thing? That one's got me all aflush with curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little cowed) You'll be the first to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wright storms off as agents delicately handle debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vista. From this point, you can see everything else in mountain range. The only thing left that's taller is the Tower, a hundred yards away. Between the two mountains li drop of a mere four thousand feet. Hal has led the rest of the gang up to the edge. Travers approaches him, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said there was an easy way across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is. You might not like it much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal points

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER DOWN
dialogues.text: A steep two hundred yard downhill climb leads to a wire t bridges the two mountains. The same wire we saw at the beginning -- left behind from Susan Collins' botched resc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course -- we'll have to do it hand over hand. Seems I forgot my harness. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. Lead on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is surprised to see Kynette pull a harness out of his -- the one Travers used earlier. Disappointed, Hal leads downward climb, looking several hundred yards to

dialogues.speaker: THE CRACK
dialogues.text: running up, and through, the bluff, coming out on this si

dialogues.speaker: HAL'S FACE
dialogues.text: registers a thought -- will he? -- then dismissal. Nah. H couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: GABE'S FACE
dialogues.text: Gabe is sweating, straining in the dark, climbing up -- t be a good spot to pull back and take in the view, except

dialogues.speaker: THE CHIMNEY
dialogues.text: -- there's nowhere to pull back to. There's about two inc of clearance between Gabe's chest and the rock, and about same between his back and the rock. To the right, there i light. At all. To the left, there's no light. Even above, there is no light, because the crack isn't straight -- na isn't that obliging -- it zig-zags up. Gabe is well withi mountain rock. Nothing could be closer to being buried al Gabe snakes through a spot where the crack goes straight he takes out his penlight and turns it on --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CRACK AROUND HIM
dialogues.text: even this dim light reveals scores of bats hanging on the wall, surrounding him, up and down, left and right --

dialogues.speaker: GABE'S FACE
dialogues.text: is stuck somewhere between nausea and the realization tha he's made a big mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't need to see that. I really didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe cuts the light and slithers up through the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie and Frank are flying low and fast, over treetops a snow -- both are intently staring down --

dialogues.speaker: THEIR VIEW
dialogues.text: is nothing but empty wilderness. But a BUZZER goes off --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE AND FRANK
dialogues.text: turn their attention to the helicopter's heat scope, whic shows something alive beneath them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got 'em -- they're under the trees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie smiles and slows the copter over a clearing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: touches down. Maggie is out of it before the rotor has st turning, running into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal! Gabe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie runs into the trees, headlong into

dialogues.speaker: A PACK OF WOLVES
dialogues.text: that are preying on -- a body. A pair of legs are gruesom sticking out from the feast. One wolf turns to SNARL at M -- but Frank runs up and pulls a gun from a holster. Frank aims high and FIRES twice to scare the pack -- the wolves run off. Maggie goes to the body -- Frank holds he back, but she goes ahead anyway, worried it might be Gabe

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON MAGGIE
dialogues.text: as she examines the body --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Evan. (she stands, looks up) Parachute failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not unkindly) Damn fool. Why would anybody try that in the middle of a storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would anybody try at all. (sighs) Get the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe has a quick climbing rhythm now. He pulls himself up his hands, then braces his body with his back, and pulls himself up again -- he's not looking up, because he can't anything yet anyway -- naturally, this leads to -- A head and rock collision. Gabe's head crashes against a part of the crack, as the passage thins out. He gropes up The passage is narrowing to the point that he can't get through it. Dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should've taken that left turn at Albequerque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe backs down, and starts to slide across the side. Wit his back wedged against the rear wall, he uses his feet t push against the forward wall.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: Zero visibility -- Gabe can't see what he's shoving towar There has never been light of any kind in here.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: blindly pushes to the side, rattled by the difficulty of this in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just like any other side move -- you can't see where the fuck you're going, that's all --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe stops and fishes out his penlight. Turning it on, it clear those batteries haven't gotten any more potent in t last few hours. Gabe shines it to the side.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: is fading fast. A match's last gasp is brighter.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: exasperated, puts the penlight in his mouth and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (garbled) Much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe inches on to the side. Looks up to see if the crack gotten wider. It hasn't. Gabe mumbles something phonetica near "motherfucker" around the flashlight, aiming it up -

dialogues.speaker: UP
dialogues.text: No opening larger than a mail slot --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: still cursing, still looking up, still moving to the side he gets the opening he wants, but not where he wants it - The crack suddenly, drastically widens as he moves to the side -- since he's been bracing his back against the wall Gabe falls out of control, twisting around, face down -- Gabe bounces down the walls for several yards and catches himself by bracing his arms and legs against the crack. I now five feet wide as he painfully brakes himself --

dialogues.speaker: THE PENLIGHT
dialogues.text: falls out of Gabe's mouth and tumbles down, ping-ponging one side of the crack to the other as it tumbles a long, way down -- even after the light is gone, we can still he the penlight's receding clattering against the walls --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: is now, literally, in a jam. There are no handholds, no ledges, and the walls are slick. All he can do is remain braced against the crack's walls until his already sore a and legs give out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is now flying the helicopter -- a body bag is stash the back, and Maggie is in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motioning down) Bring it down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The copter touches down -- Frank doesn't turn it off. Mag jumps out with a walkie talkie. Frank makes another try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie, this is dumb --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it isn't. I'm going to find Brett -- I don't want to have to talk to his widow too. Fly Evan's body back to base -- I'll call you when I've found Brett. Or Hal. Or Gabe. Or anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie runs off into the snow as Frank lifts off. Maggie quickly through the snow, and it isn't long before she sp multiple tracks in the snow -- they lead toward, and up, buttress. Now she's really confused. But with nothing lef do, she starts climbing up the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we've caught Hal in mid-crossing, he's looking from wh he came -- the opposite side of the buttress, where Trave has a gun trained on him --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: unhappily hangs high above the ground from the harness ki provided by Travers --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE WIRE
dialogues.text: Kristel is waiting, also with a gun trained on him. Hal arrives and disengages -- the harness is pulled back.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTRESS SIDE OF WIRE
dialogues.text: Kynette pulls the harness back and hands it to Qualen, wh standing next to Travers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motioning up) I'm going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- this part is nothing, believe me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walker should be coming up by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kynette, automatic strapped to his chest, rushes back to buttress' summit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe is just as we left him. Face down, arms and legs pre against the five-foot gap of the tunnel walls. Carefully, Gabe takes one hand off the wall, gets out his lighter with the other, and ignites it for a look --

dialogues.speaker: UPWARD
dialogues.text: Just as the crack has widened below him -- it's wider abo him. More important, it slants at an easy enough angle to allow him to walk up. If only he can get up there.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: snaps the lighter shut, pockets it, and readies himself. Gabe steadily "walks" up the vertical passage by bracing himself with one leg and one arm -- then moving the other leg and arm up. Gabe repeats this until he has his hands on the curved ed where the crack snakes into a sideways passage. But there no handholds that will allow Gabe to get a grip and simpl swing over and climb up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winded) So much for the easy part.

dialogues.speaker: THE CRACK
dialogues.text: Gabe takes a deep breath, readies himself, and shoves him away from the wall with his arms, pushes himself into a s against the opposite wall, hanging for a second with no support at all, and he springs from that all into

dialogues.speaker: THE DIAGONAL PASSAGE
dialogues.text: Gabe lands hard but flat on the passage and immediately s backsliding into the drop, but he digs in with his boots his hands. Safe at last. Gabe carefully stands in a crouc and starts heading up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kynette moves to the edge, lies flat, and looks down --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUTTRESS SIDE
dialogues.text: Maggie is climbing up, but she's still some way down -- a the hood of her parka has been pulled over her head. All Kynette can see is what she's wearing: an orange parka.

dialogues.speaker: KYNETTE
dialogues.text: smiles and hits his headset radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on the way up. I could hear that jacket before I could see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Then get the money, kill him and get back here. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) I'll wait till he comes to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kynette flattens out to wait -- Maggie is coming up fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe moves up through the diagonal section -- the crack i starting to go directly upward. Gabe looks up --

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF THE CRACK
dialogues.text: It's coated with snow, but not too much -- Gabe can faint make out light shining through up there.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: knows the top is twenty feet away. Gabe starts up the eas segment, his back braced against one wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is staring down intently at the climber below --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: is now almost to the top -- sweating with exertion, she t her hood back.

dialogues.speaker: KYNETTE
dialogues.text: keys his headset radio again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Bulletin. The climber isn't Walker -- it's a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe, wedged near the top of the crack, is ready to dig through the snow -- but he hears the sound, muffled and distant, of Kynette talking. Gabe strains to hear -- a ba time to come up? Might be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie, tired, gets near the top and collapses, resting f moment, her arms on the edge -- Maggie looks up and is ve surprised to see Kynette, standing over her, smiling, his aimed down at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rotten weather for a climb, huh? (aims barrel) I have two questions I'd like to trouble you with. Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie stares up, frozen -- whatever she was expecting, i wasn't this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This first one's easy. Do you know a man named Gabe Walker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (breathless, scared) Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know either? I am sorry. That was question number two. (lowers barrel) Thanks for your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kynette tightens his finger around the trigger --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: appears -- he completes his run toward Kynette's back and kicks him over the edge --

dialogues.speaker: KYNETTE
dialogues.text: goes flying over Maggie, his shots going wild -- but he catches himself on the rock and comes to a painful but sa halt after skidding down ten feet --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: yanks Maggie to her feet and onto the top. Maggie gets a look at Gabe -- his clothes are slashed, he's covered wit cuts, and coated with slime and dirt from the crack. He l like he's just spent a week in Hell. Gabe doesn't react t reaction -- he just grabs her hand and runs.

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN
dialogues.text: chooses this moment to show up at the opposite edge -- he fires and automatic BURST at Gabe and Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe jumps on a spot in the snow over the crack, caving i in -- Gabe falls two feet into

dialogues.speaker: THE CRACK
dialogues.text: Gabe has grabbed, and is hanging from, a rope anchored to piton on the edge of the rock. He's also glowering up at Maggie a little impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, goddamit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe rappels down the rope into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: hesitates -- she's still getting used to the idea of bein shot at --

dialogues.speaker: KYNETTE
dialogues.text: woozy but recovered, has climbed up -- he runs toward the opening, FIRING his gun --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: drops into the relative safety of the crack and rappels downward. Maggie reaches rope's end thirty feet down, as the vertic passage again becomes diagonal. Gabe is there waiting.

dialogues.speaker: KYNETTE
dialogues.text: reaches the edge of the crack and FIRES down into it --

dialogues.speaker: GABE AND MAGGIE
dialogues.text: -- bullets are RICOCHETING all over -- Gabe throws himsel over Maggie to shield her.

dialogues.speaker: KYNETTE
dialogues.text: can't see what he's shooting at, so he mercifully stops. Seeing the rope, he bends down to climb after them --

dialogues.speaker: GABE AND MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Gabe reaches up and tugs gently on the rope twice --

dialogues.speaker: KYNETTE
dialogues.text: -- which is tied in a standard climber's slipknot and com undone with a final tug -- the rope, freed of the piton, down, but Kynette firmly grabs hold of the end --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: feels the rope go taut -- he yanks the rope down hard --

dialogues.speaker: KYNETTE
dialogues.text: gets more pull than he counted on and takes a head first into the crack, disappearing with a scream -- Qualen has arrived in time to see this --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: looks over as Kynette bounces past him, a few feet away - rope goes slack in his hand as Kynette falls below.

dialogues.speaker: UP ABOVE
dialogues.text: in frustration, FIRES a burst straight down into the crac

dialogues.speaker: GABE AND MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Gabe and Maggie move laterally through the crack -- now a thirty feet from where they started, so ricochets are a serious but decreasing problem. The crack narrows from five to three feet. Gabe edges Mag down into it, and along a ledge moving to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way. (off Maggie's look) I like the outside of the mountain better too, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe and Maggie move along the ledge --

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN
dialogues.text: is still at the edge of the crack -- stymied. He's defini not climbing down after them -- he pulls back from the ed

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CRACK/CHIMNEY
dialogues.text: find a comparative point of comfort -- a toe-sized ledge. Maggie is moving ahead of Gabe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted, Gabe braces himself against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Maggie) I'm glad to see you -- but Christ, I wish you hadn't come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen whizzes across the wire on the harness, easily mak it to where Hal, Travers and Kristel are waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disengaging) He's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers takes a couple of heavy swings at the connecting with Hal's axe. Qualen grabs his arm before he can take a third swing -- and looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For another two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CRACK/CHIMNEY
dialogues.text: Gabe catches his breath. All this is taking its toll on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts just looking at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still panting) Try it from this side. Do you still have your radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not going to work in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's give it a try. (she hands it to him) I'm in bad need of a ride. (keys it) Come in, Rescue Unit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is leading the expedition upward along a ledge -- the radio, in Travers' pack, comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) -- Come in, Rescue One --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers stares daggers at Qualen. Qualen looks to his wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio is reading Gabe loud, if not clear -- the interference of solid rock is garbling it. But we can see the window that Frank is now between radios, carefully hauling Evan's body from the helicopter to the station on collapsible gurney. No one else is in the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio, broken up) -- Come in, Frank --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe, exasperated, stops for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anybody else on the radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take a year off and the department goes to hell. (keys it) -- Come in, Rescue Unit --

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF BUTTRESS
dialogues.text: We can see there are three holes punched in the snow alon crack's top --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recognizably the part of the crack Gabe and Maggie dove into -- but perched on the edge is a block of plastic explosive -- the detonator LED races down -- 0:20 -- 0:19

dialogues.speaker: A SECOND HOLE
dialogues.text: has been punched in the snow at the center point of the crevice's top -- another bomb has been planted there --

dialogues.speaker: A THIRD HOLE
dialogues.text: at the opposite end of the crevice has a third timer tied a third pack of plastics --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen is staring at his watch, but pointing the others t the buttress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (via radio) Come in, Frank -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to get thirty million in entertainment out of this, because he is definitely in for thirty million worth of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe's radio calls continue as Qualen extends his arm tow the buttress and starts a silent hand countdown, stage ma style -- five -- four -- three --

dialogues.speaker: TIMER
dialogues.text: The LED runs down -- 0:02 -- 0:01 --

dialogues.speaker: THE BUTTRESS TOP
dialogues.text: is shattered by a huge blast as the first bomb detonates

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CRACK/CHIMNEY
dialogues.text: The walls are pulverized near the top and cave in, rainin rocks further down towards --

dialogues.speaker: GABE AND MAGGIE
dialogues.text: who are hit by a blast of air booming down through the confined space -- Gabe drops the radio -- Maggie slips, b Gabe grabs her -- both slide down the crack, out of contr until it narrows to a three foot width -- and they stop - Gabe shoves Maggie against the wall and tries to protect with his body as the rocks start to rain down --

dialogues.speaker: TOWER FACE
dialogues.text: Hal lunges at Qualen, but is held back by Travers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sick fuck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. They may still be alive. That was the small one.

dialogues.speaker: RESCUE STATION
dialogues.text: Frank stops wheeling the gurney and looks up at the far-o blast, and the smoke, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus -- that's some flare.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CRACK
dialogues.text: Rocks tumble down it, filling it in and sealing it off --

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER DOWN
dialogues.text: is braced over Maggie, protecting her from the first roun falling rocks, but rolling THUNDER in the crack announces more is coming -- Gabe looks up as the noise gets closer

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE IN THE CRACK
dialogues.text: The rockslide arrives -- the crack is filled in seconds w rocks and dirt, packing it in -- Gabe tries to hold on, b shoved down by the falling rocks -- Maggie, however, is buried in the crack as it fills --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: is knocked down to a point where the crack narrows -- he himself by jamming his body against the sides. Suddenly, quiet. A little dirt whistles through, but that's all. The cave-in has stopped, as it's filled in the crack abov And Maggie is in the middle of it.  Gabe unsheaths his ic and starts hacking up to get at Maggie. Dirt and rocks fa his face as he digs --

dialogues.speaker: BOMB NUMBER TWO
dialogues.text: Another LED is counting down from 3:00 -- 2:59 -- 2:58 --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CRACK
dialogues.text: Gabe frantically hacks at the ceiling of dirt -- rock and tumble down, but no sign of Maggie. Gabe uncovers one of Maggie's feet. Is it too late? Gabe digs up around her -- Maggie realizes Gabe is there -- she starts kicking. Finally Maggie tumbles out of the cave-in -- gasping and coughing, but alive.  Gabe catches her and brushes the di off her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified, coughing) Why are they doing this?

dialogues.speaker: RESCUE STATION
dialogues.text: Frank, having lain Evan's body to rest, runs back to the helicopter, starts it up and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CRACK/CHIMNEY
dialogues.text: Gabe is leading Maggie horizontally through the crack, fa and furious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up) We might be able to get up that way -- there's an opening --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- there could be another bomb up there -- even if there isn't, we could get another cave-in. The only sure way out is through the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Treasury agents sift debris as Davis runs up to Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got something here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an unconfirmed report of a distress call made from a plane that crashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really, really interesting, but -- (gestures around) -- kind of old news, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This call was supposedly made from a plane that crash landed. After it landed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waves it off) Sounds like they got it wrong. Next time you interrupt my work make sure it's something I can use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe and Maggie cautiously move along a single ledge -- finally, some light can be seen, thirty feet ahead, as th round a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Come on -- we're almost out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crack narrows, and Gabe straddles it, putting his fee the opposite edge to walk faster. But before he can go on

dialogues.speaker: A HAND
dialogues.text: grabs one of Gabe's ankles from below and yanks him down Gabe tumbles painfully, braking himself in front of

dialogues.speaker: KYNETTE
dialogues.text: bruised and bloody, who has survived the earlier fall and his way out. His look is not a forgiving one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kynette smashes Gabe's face with a devastating, brass-knu punch --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: falls back, desperately grabbing at the walls to stop him from going all the way down -- as he weakly tries to get

dialogues.speaker: KYNETTE
dialogues.text: calmly opens his knife, and re-laces his fingers into its brass-knuckle handle.

dialogues.speaker: TOWER FACE
dialogues.text: The gang and Hal watch the mountain top, with very differ expectations and hopes -- their vantage point keeps them seeing where the crack actually comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks to Hal) You might say a few words for your friends -- this is the one that will bury them.

dialogues.speaker: BOMB NUMBER TWO
dialogues.text: Ready to blow -- 0:10 -- 0:09 --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CRACK
dialogues.text: can only look down helplessly at

dialogues.speaker: GABE AND KYNETTE
dialogues.text: fighting -- Gabe is on his feet, but Kynette, slashing at with his knife, is forcing Gabe to back up -- the crack i getting wider, and finding footholds while crab-walking backwards in the dark isn't east. Gabe's in a rotten fighting position -- as he has to spre his feet out wider as he backs up, he's always lower than Kynette. Gabe throws a punch at Kynette's stomach, but there's no to it. Kynette hits Gabe with a brutal knuckle-duster pun Gabe flies back several feet, somehow managing to straddl crack walls -- which are now four feet apart. Kynette mov for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: BOMB NUMBER TWO
dialogues.text: The LED counts down -- 0:02 -- 0:01 -- 0:00 -- but doesn' detonate. A green light starts flashing, but the bomb has gone off.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CRACK/CHIMNEY
dialogues.text: Kynette moves in over Gabe and swings down with the knife But Gabe grabs his knife hand, and adding his own force t swing, imbeds the knife to the hilt in the rock wall, trapping Kynette's hand in the brass-knuckle handle. Gabe stabilizes himself on Kynette's trapped arm and gets little payback -- three solid roundhouse punches to Kynet face -- he then climbs up his pinned opponent, stepping u on Kynette's stuck hand as if it were a piton.

dialogues.speaker: TOWER FACE
dialogues.text: Qualen's smirk is wiped off his face. The bomb didn't wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure -- I set the timer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen gestures helplessly, putting the radio in Hal's re Hal takes advantage of this, throws off Travers, and grab radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keying radio) Gabe, it's a dud --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the second Hal transmits --

dialogues.speaker: BOMB NUMBER TWO
dialogues.text: detonates over the central part of the crevice, and as promised, it's even bigger than the first --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CRACK
dialogues.text: The bomb instantly blasts tons of rock down the crevice -

dialogues.speaker: GABE AND MAGGIE
dialogues.text: The RUMBLE of the approaching rockslide is unmistakable - Gabe shoves Maggie forward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie doesn't have to be told twice -- she and Gabe move the narrowed crack quickly, but under the circumstances, this "running" looks damn slow --

dialogues.speaker: KYNETTE
dialogues.text: struggles with the stuck knife as the cave-in knocks him the wall and buries him instantly --

dialogues.speaker: GABE AND MAGGIE
dialogues.text: cover the last ten feet, shoved forward by an airburst fr the giant explosion -- they make it to the crack's edge a last, but on the

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE OF THE MOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: Gabe and Maggie still have to cling desperately to the sh wall -- the airburst has turned the crack into a wind tunnel -- it's as if the mountain were trying to blow the out.

dialogues.speaker: TOWER FACE
dialogues.text: Hal, shocked, stares at the enormity of the explosion. Qu looks serenely satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was seventeen, I was a sentry on the East Berlin boundary. There was a problem, then -- too many defectors were managing to sneak through the wilderness to the west. A man would take them through, every night of every week -- a man like your friend. (beat) He had quite a sense of humor. Every time he got someone through, he'd radio us at midnight to let us know how many. "Five tonight." "Eight more have been freed tonight." No one could find the route. It made me look bad. (beat) I looked day and night and finally I found it. A tunnel. I didn't tell me superiors. I put a charge there, with a timer to trigger a radio receiver on the detonator. At midnight. Our friend made his radio report, and I heard him say "seven" before the explosion. (beat) They pulled eight bodies out of the tunnel, and I was promoted to intelligence the next day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, stunned, looks at the radio, realizing Qualen tricke him into detonating the bomb. Travers, grinning, takes th radio from Hal and pats him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. We couldn't have killed him without you.

dialogues.speaker: GABE AND MAGGIE
dialogues.text: The force of the airburst, as brief as it is strong, is o Dust slowly swirls out -- Gabe and Maggie raise their hea Gabe looks back -- the crack is now sealed off. Gabe take piton and hammer from his belt and hands it to Maggie alo with the rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock this in the side. Make it firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie does as Gabe takes the binoculars out, and climbs on a slim toehold so he can look up the wall.

dialogues.speaker: UP THE WALL
dialogues.text: Gabe whips the binoculars up to the top edge of the wall. blurry -- Gabe focuses the binoculars on -- the third bomb, visible on the mountain's edge. The LED counts down but it's partly obscured. All Gabe can see is the seconds the minutes, that remain -- :42 -- :41 --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad news. There's another bomb up there. We've got to move quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe scans methodically but rapidly down the rock below. smooth. Until -- Gabe swings the binoculars back. There's lip ninety feet below, leading into the wall. A cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good news. There's a cave down there.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: puts away the binoculars and swings back to Maggie -- she the length of rope drop. It's thirty feet long. Not even almost long enough to get to the shelter. Gabe leans agai the crack wall, drained. Now what?

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Frank is in the air, heading back out toward the range, frantically working the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie -- come in, Maggie, this is Rescue One --

dialogues.speaker: TOWER FACE
dialogues.text: Frank's call is heard on the radio. Travers takes it, and takes charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's our ride out of here. Everyone out of sight -- except you, Kristel. (hands her radio) Make the distress call. You're so good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All scramble up towards the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: THE THIRD BOMB
dialogues.text: We can see what Gabe couldn't -- the timer has about two minutes left -- 1:59 -- 1:58 --

dialogues.speaker: GABE AND MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Gabe looks completely defeated. Can't go up. Can't go bac Can't go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defeated) Die. I'm sorry, Maggie. I'm sorry you got into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe and Maggie fuse together in a tight embrace -- a fin embrace. But Gabe opens his eyes as the rope, still in Maggie's hand, brushes his cheek. The end is frayed. Gabe's eyes light up. Inspiration. Gabe breaks off the em and snatches the rope from her -- he pulls at the end and furiously starts unravelling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis has just filled in Wright on the "unconfirmed" dist call. Wright looks furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't think a distress call from a crashed plane was "important"? (Davis nods) Get me a fucking radio! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: flying over the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is practically there, heading toward the buttress a the facing Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Come in, Maggie, over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio -- "weak") Alpha Charlie Niner -- please -- help --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank recognizes the pilot's voice from the "distress cal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) I copy, Charlie Niner -- what's your position -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An aerial flare fires up, leaving a clear marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Sit tight, Charlie Niner -- I'm right on top of you.

dialogues.speaker: GABE AND MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Gabe is still unravelling the rope fiber -- it's three different segments wound together. The helicopter flies overhead -- and past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting, waving) Frank! Down here! Frank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about it. He can't hear you. (hands Maggie some rope) Tie these together. Tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) -- Are you out of your mind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is rope from the Gordon exhibit. The way guys climbed then, they'd tie on three at a time -- this rope'll take around nine hundred pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe -- this rope is sixty years old --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (misses the point) Yeah, they made it pretty good then. Each of these strands ought to hold about 300 pounds before snapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe rapidly ties the rope to the piton -- Maggie works o third connecting knot as she does the mental calculation what she and Gabe weigh together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazed) Ought to. About. (beat) Will it hold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe takes the line from her and lets it drop. Ninety fee what looks like twine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on how big a breakfast you had. You want to go first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie's stunned -- but there's no choice. She starts the rappel down, and Gabe is close behind.

dialogues.speaker: THE THIRD BOMB
dialogues.text: is ready to blow -- 0:12 -- 0:11 --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE AND GABE
dialogues.text: To make this even trickier, they have to swing over to th side about fifteen feet to get to the cave -- meaning the have to move down in pendulum type swings that put even m pressure on

dialogues.speaker: THE ROPE
dialogues.text: which looks sorely tested at one knot -- it's coming undo

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE AND GABE
dialogues.text: They swing down lower -- twenty feet to the cave, four thousand to the ground --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE AND GABE
dialogues.text: They reach the end of the rope -- six feet above the cave and fifteen feet away laterally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Swing towards it -- and drop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie nods -- they start the swing over -- as they get o the cave's lip --

dialogues.speaker: THE ROPE
dialogues.text: snaps --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE AND GABE
dialogues.text: fall, landing roughly on the cave's narrow lip -- Gabe starts to slip over, but Maggie pulls him back as --

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE ON THE WALL
dialogues.text: The bomb detonates and starts raining debris -- an instan massive rockslide --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE AND GABE
dialogues.text: dive into the small cave as the rockslide tumbles past -- exhausted, they collapse on the cave floor.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Frank, obviously, is surprised by the nearby explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he sees Kristel in a clearing. Face down in the snow. First things first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lands near her, and rushes over to her. Frank turns over and breaks a capsule under her nose. She "wakes up" a start and looks "terrified".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- who are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'm here to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovered) Glad to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristel sees the snap is off Frank's holster -- she grabs spins it around, and pulls the trigger. CLICK. Frank grab her wrist with a move faster than you'd expect from him, he yanks the pistol back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jailhouse load. First chamber's empty -- (aims gun) -- the rest aren't. Forgive me, but things have been a little strange this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, the helicopter radio crackles to life. Frank back toward the helicopter, keeping the gun trained on Kristel But Frank only gets to the helicopter door before --

dialogues.speaker: DELMER
dialogues.text: comes out of hiding and empties a clip from his automatic Frank. Frank is pinned to the door by the fusillade befor can even get a shot off. Travers runs over to Delmer and shoves the barrel up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! (explaining) You'll damage the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if to punctuate this, Frank -- and the now ruined pilo side door -- fall to the ground. The radio continues to s as Travers grabs Frank's discarded gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kristel) Answer that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristel brushes the snow off her and goes over to the rad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Calling Rocky Mountain Rescue -- come in, Rocky Mountain Rescue -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keying radio) Rocky Mountain Rescue One, over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wright, davis, and an irritated Stuart huddle over a radi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Ross Stuart, Federal Aviation Administration -- please identify -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now, the others have come out of hiding and up to the helicopter. Kristel grabs some papers from a plastic pack the helicopter seat -- and keys the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy, FAA. This is Margaret Deighan, Rocky Mountain Rescue. Over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have an unconfirmed report of an air crash in your area, and a distress call on this frequency -- can you confirm -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keying mike) Copy, FAA. Distress call came at approximately eleven hundred hours yesterday. I investigated -- the call turned out to be a false alarm. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart gestures with exasperated triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please repeat, Rocky Mountain Rescue -- distress call was a false alarm? -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Repeat, distress call was a definite false alarm -- we've had several here. Somebody's sick idea of a joke. Do you require further assistance -- over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not from you. Thanks, Rocky Mountain Rescue -- over and out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart shuts off the radio with finality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to say I told you so. But I did. Can I go back to work now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristel smiles and puts the radio mike back into its brac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost believed you myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers smiles and turns, looking at

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: trembling with fury and grief, bent over Frank's body as last trace of vapor -- his breath -- trails from his lips He's gone. Hal gently closes the eyes of his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) Goodbye, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers moves up behind Hal and kicks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for number three. Unless you want to have a longer conversation with him elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers kicks him in the face, knocking him into the snow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll wait here. You just murdered three of my friends. Sooner or later, whoever's chasing you is going to show up and return the favor, and I'd love to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers puts his gun at Hal's forehead and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself.
