You see, we just had a little interface with several branches of the federal government -- one of whose members I know has zero imagination -- and I can tell you, the cavalry just isn't going to make it by this week. (beat) No, you're taking us where we want to go. Because you want to return that favor and you want to do more than watch. You want to kill me -- more than anything, even more than you want to keep on breathing, and with a little more time you pray you'll get that chance. (tightens trigger) Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal's answer is a stony, loathing stare. He gets up. But

dialogues.speaker: HAL'S HAND
dialogues.text: -- we can see Hal has palmed something from Frank's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust from the rockslide is drifting past the cave opening the worst is over. Gabe rolls Maggie over carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ears are ringing -- but I'm all right. Gabe, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shows money in his pack) This. That plane crash -- it's a half dozen guys who were smart enough to steal fifty million bucks, but dumb enough to drop it all over the range. They've got Hal as a bird dog -- and right now they're heading for the rest of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's close to the lake -- Hal's probably leading them on the slowest possible route down to it. (stiffly gets up) I can get there first -- all I have to do is make it along the north wall to the Bitker ladder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "All?" Jesus, Gabe -- what do you expect to do then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aching) Something -- subtle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe lurches towards the cave opening, looking more like Quasimodo than a champion climber. Maggie stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. You're climbing back down -- try to get to the station or find some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just as good a climber as you are -- and right now, I'm definitely in better shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard) And you're definitely not going --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie stares Gabe down. Guess who won all the arguments they were together. Gabe's face is a portrait of familiar exasperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Come on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move out of the cave together, Gabe favors one fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but the second you slow me down, I'm leaving -- (slips on sore leg, Maggie catches him) -- I'm leaving you behind. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helping Gabe out) Anything you say, Gabe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have a good imagination, this corner of charcoal l like it could have been --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the currency cases.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT AND DAVIS
dialogues.text: are standing over some of the wreckage. One of the suits and tags the "briefcase".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've tested the ash inside -- it's the right paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's -- hard to tell. But forensics says yes. All of them were in the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sags with the news) Everything's accounted for, then -- time to head back and start making excuses. (beat) Fifty million bucks up in smoke, and I just don't give a shit. It's one more run of the press. But we lost five good men and they aren't so easily replaced. (beat) Especially a guy like Travers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dedicated agent Travers leans in reasonable comfort again the helicopter and keys his headset mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen. How far along are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Not as far as we'd be with the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER DOWN ON MOUNTAIN/TOWER
dialogues.text: Qualen, Kristel and Delmer follow Hal's lead down the sid it's not too steep a grade, but it's solid rock and it's covered with ice and fresh snow -- all have to brace themselves with their hands to keep from slipping down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) We have less than half a tank of fuel, Eric -- if we burn it up treasure hunting we'll never get off this rock. Now -- how far away are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys radio) It looks like two miles, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen's foot slides out from under him -- he catches him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it'll take some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Time we have -- Walker's dead, Wright's an idiot. And our guide --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys radio) What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) As soon as he becomes a convenience instead of a necessity -- kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys radio) Agreed.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: can only hear Qualen's end of the conversation -- but his shows he can guess what they're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: GABE'S FACE
dialogues.text: Gabe's rattled too -- but for a brand new reason -- we PU BACK to see Gabe at

dialogues.speaker: THE WIRE'S EDGE
dialogues.text: where the wire -- that wire -- links the buttress with th facing Tower. Whipping in the wind, it looks risky -- but that's not the problem. Gabe stares at the other edge for a moment. Immobile. Remembering Susan's death. Gabe shakes out of it when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe? (beat) I'll go first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) If I don't go first, I might not go at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe hooks his ankles over the wire and starts dragging himself, hand over hand, across the abyss -- no safety li this time. As his weight pulls the line taut, the wind ro him back and forth. Gabe steadily drags himself out --

dialogues.speaker: GABE ON WIRE
dialogues.text: Fatigue stops Gabe in the middle -- a half mile up, strun between two gigantic mountains, he looks as insignificant alone as a man possibly can be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panting with exertion, frozen -- he can barely hold his g and has an elbow crooked around the wire for support. Gab eyes are shut -- he looks near collapse --

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Gabe is falling from the wire in slow motion, trailing Susan -- she spirals out of reach as his line SNAPS him back --

dialogues.speaker: GABE'S
dialogues.text: grip unconsciously relaxes -- but his eyes jolt open and clamps both hands shut on the wire. Gabe, drawing on some inner fury, drags himself with long, sharp yanks --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: tensely watches Gabe's crossing --

dialogues.speaker: OVERVIEW
dialogues.text: is about ten feet away from the end --

dialogues.speaker: THE END OF THE WIRE
dialogues.text: looks a lot further away than that --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: pulls faster -- and reaches the other side. Gabe maintain hand grip and swings his feet onto the ledge, leaning bac against the wall to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winded, shouting across) Think you can beat my time?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: smiles -- this is more like the Gabe she remembers. She g on the wire and starts across in a fast, easy rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: watches her, grinning. Admiration for Maggie is washing a bad memories of Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Shit -- she is in better shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie pulls across fearlessly -- but --

dialogues.speaker: THE BOLT
dialogues.text: on Gabe's side of the wire is giving where Travers had hacked at it -- just a millimeter, but it's pulling loose

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: doesn't notice and shouts across at Maggie, now half way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enjoying it now) Quit sandbagging it -- I haven't got all day --

dialogues.speaker: THE BOLT
dialogues.text: is coming looser -- Maggie's quicker crossing is thrashin wire and straining the bolt's weakened anchoring --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: who is now twenty feet away -- fifteen -- ten -- five --

dialogues.speaker: THE BOLT
dialogues.text: pops out of the wall as if it were shot --

dialogues.speaker: THE WIRE
dialogues.text: which was tight as a bowstring fires out into the chasm - Maggie, stunned and without options, lets go two feet sho of the ledge --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: drops low just as Maggie starts to fall and swings his ar towards hers in one lightning-fast motion --

dialogues.speaker: THEIR HANDS
dialogues.text: catch --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: maintains his grip on Maggie's hand, but her weight nearl pulls him off the ledge -- Maggie drags him down, the win goes out of his chest when it collides with the ledge's bottom, but their grip holds. All of this in a split second. Maggie hangs from Gabe's a locked in terror -- but skill wins out over fear. She fin handhold with her free arm, and climbs up to the ledge wi Gabe's help. Maggie collapses into Gabe's arms and they f back against the wall, but Gabe's the one who's really ho on tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That -- tears it. (gasping) You're not coming any further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just as breathless) Gabe -- you're going to get yourself killed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breath almost back) Maybe. But I'm not getting you killed. (she starts a reply) Look, Maggie. I don't know what'll happen when I catch up with Hal -- but I've got to know one thing for sure -- that you're making it off this mountain. Alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe's eyes are pleading. Maggie hesitates. But gives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe lightly kisses Maggie -- he doesn't want to turn thi into a farewell kiss, afraid that that's really what it m be. They stand -- and separate. Gabe moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the trail and stay out of sight. (beat) I'll see you on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie wonders if she will as Gabe vanishes around a corn

dialogues.speaker: BODY BAG
dialogues.text: as the zipper is pulled down -- before we can see anythin mercifully reverse POV to

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT, DAVIS AND STUART
dialogues.text: near a helicopter, look down with disgust. Davis turns aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give up. What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SEARCH PILOT zips the bag back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ID says this used to be your pilot. (beat) And we found him seven miles east of the wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis and Wright look at each other, drawing the same conclusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hijack. (beat) The plane was hijacked. Son of a bitch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, give me a break. Your pilot lost it when the flight started going south, and he bailed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me -- but there's no parachute there. Check it yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before this can go on, a FORENSICS AGENT runs up to Stuar carrying a recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir -- we found the flight recorder -- it was driven twenty feet deep into a crater. It was demolished, but we salvaged the recording --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing it away) I've heard a thousand of these, Wright -- whoever was at the stick is going to begin by screeching the Lord's Prayer and wind up screaming "Oh, shit" at ground zero --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart clicks the recorder on with a flourish, but his sm look melts as the voice of FBI agent Matheson explains --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting, rushed) -- the money's been stolen -- Travers and the pilot were in on it -- the pilot's dead, but Travers took the cash and made a mid-air transfer to a jet flown by Qualen -- controls won't respond -- (screaming) shiiiiii--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson is cut off by the sound of impact, which is foll by silence. Wright gently turns the recorder off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess we're both right, Stuart. Thanks for your expertise. (turns to pilot) Well? (jerking a thumb back) You'll be waiting till Groundhog's Day for him to pull his head out of his ass -- let's get it in the air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wright, Davis and the pilot scramble into a helicopter -- Stuart pauses, but goes after them.

dialogues.speaker: LEDGE
dialogues.text: that's a little narrower than your coffee table. It's got irregular breaks, causing it to go up or down several fee and Gabe is jogging it, leaping across the ledge's gaps, leaning toward the wall -- and away from the four thousan foot drop. Gabe's gotten his second wind -- he keeps jumping from le to ledge with the ease that comes from skill and familiar and with renewed purpose. Gabe makes the last jump to a section of ledge near the bottom of

dialogues.speaker: THE "BITKER" LADDER
dialogues.text: which consists of metal rungs woven into loose steel cabl bolted into the rock, running two hundred feet to the top something left behind by a past expedition, now a tourist toy. And the bottom rung is three feet above Gabe's outstretched arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't gotten any lower in the last year. (coiling for jump) Bitker, you cheap bastard. Would another four feet have killed you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe leaps up, grabbing the bottom rung instead of a half of air, and he shoots up the ladder as we PULL BACK --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A closer look at terrain seen earlier -- fifty yards away the ladder, a waterfall is spewing out of the wall, givin appearance that the mountain has sprung a torrential leak As we track Gabe up the ladder, we can see where the wate coming from -- a whirling lake on top of the mountain. It constant motion keeps it from totally freezing, but the l is still coated with a veneer of ice, moving in thick chu through circular currents on the surface.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE ON MOUNTAIN SLOPE
dialogues.text: are negotiating the grade, which is slippery, thanks to t fresh, thick snow -- we can see from their relative posit to the lake that Gabe has a lead on them. A very slight o

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF LADDER
dialogues.text: pulls himself over and starts running -- as he does, he uproots a big, 3' x 3' park service sign commemorating th "BITKER CLIMB" and takes it with him, moving ahead into a

dialogues.speaker: WOODED AREA
dialogues.text: where Gabe replants the sign near the top of another slop Gabe heads down towards some rocks -- -- and spots the th case, which took a tough landing on one rock -- it's shat into halves, and the bands of $5000s are scattered around the snow. Gabe rushes down behind a rock and starts gathering the cash -- soaked by the snow, they've frozen into ice brick Gabe stuffs them into his pack, he's startled by somethin coming over the rock -- Gabe whirls around to face

dialogues.speaker: A RABBIT
dialogues.text: that's landed in the snow and looks a lot more frightened Gabe was. Gabe leans back, relieved. For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are closer now -- but as they move down, Hal freezes in p as he sees the "Bitker" sign some distance ahead. The sig out of place. A signal from Gabe -- he is alive. And here Qualen and the others check the monitor. Hal takes the opportunity to back up to a rock formation and swiftly, s wedge something into a crack behind his back --

dialogues.speaker: THE OBJECT
dialogues.text: is what Hal lifted off Frank's body -- a speed load cylin from a revolver, with six fresh bullets in it.

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN
dialogues.text: checks the monitor -- the relative position shows they're

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but Qualen's grin is wiped away as he looks down at --

dialogues.speaker: THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: -- the tracer blip is moving -- fast -- away from their position!

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN'S
dialogues.text: face shifts from incredulity to realization to rage. All eyes are on the monitor -- Hal, at the rock formation one hand behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: HAL'S HAND
dialogues.text: shakes a box of matches from his sleeve -- he slides a si wooden match halfway out of the pack -- and ignites it wi his thumbnail --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: moves away from the rock, to draw their attention from wh he's been doing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no -- you didn't lose another one, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmer clicks off his safety and aims at Hal -- Qualen ru into the woods, guided by the monitor -- Kristel follows. Delmer backs Hal up at gunpoint. Hal deliberately moves i semi-circle, putting Delmer's back to the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) Kill him! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmer grins as he aims at Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me -- where would you like the first half dozen shots to go?

dialogues.speaker: THE MATCH
dialogues.text: has burned more than halfway down to the rest of the box, which is behind the speed load cylinder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands up) As long as you're taking requests -- how about -- the base of your spine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmer smiles and starts to squeeze the trigger -- Hal te up, it's now or never --

dialogues.speaker: THE MATCH
dialogues.text: burns down to the box, igniting all the matches --

dialogues.speaker: ON DELMER
dialogues.text: as there is the sudden sound of six distinct, consecutive gunshots behind him -- the fire's blasted the powder in a the bullets. Delmer, startled, spins around and FIRES up, FIRES down, FIRES across -- by the time he realizes no on there and he turns back around to find -- -- Hal is gone, vanished into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING QUALEN
dialogues.text: through the woods -- up a slope, around a tree, down anot slope -- his eyes fixed on the screen and the blip that's zig-zagging just ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tagging headset radio) Travers. Get down here. Now.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: is trying to repair the helicopter door when the call com

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you found the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Walker has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers, furious, flings the door aside, jumps into the c and starts the rotor.

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN
dialogues.text: is running alone, following the monitor lead -- until he a band of $5000s in the snow. Sure he's on the right trac Qualen picks it up and picks up his pace too. But we can that behind him and higher up --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: who is on a rise behind a rock, watches Qualen's futile pursuit from a distance, amused. Amused, until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would have lived longer, if you weren't such a smartass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe spins his head around -- and his temple smacks into Kristel's gun barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You telegraphed this kind of stunt with that joke snowman. Too bad for you we're not all gullible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristel starts to squeeze the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing for Qualen you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pauses, wary) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he comes back, he's going to shoot you and the other guy, grab the money, and take off with Travers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squeezing trigger again) No sale. Say "night-night" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking fast) He already blew up one of your pals in that crevice. And I've been in that copter. It goes a hell of a lot farther with two people than with four. (beat) Am I wrong? Give him a buzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristel eases back with the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got my attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've also got all the money. And I can show you how to get off the mountain with it. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE ON MOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: tears into a clearing, trying to put some distance betwee and Delmer -- as soon as he's out in the open, though,

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: thunders over Hal -- Travers FIRES down at Hal through th doorless pilot's side. Bullets kick up tufts of snow at H heels as he runs down into a steep, sloping wooded area. tree cover is too thick for Travers to take good aim. Loo like temporary refuge -- but

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Travers finds a new use for the search copter's heat scope -- using the blip that betrays Hal's body heat as a guide, Travers can still fire down through the trees at

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: who's still running down the grade -- he hasn't been hit but there's an awful lot of bad luck in the air --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: banks the helicopter around and up for another pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is slogging uphill after his own tracer blip -- which is turning back around and heading towards him. Qualen aims gun and waits, but at the top of the hill --

dialogues.speaker: THE RABBIT
dialogues.text: that spooked Gabe earlier sticks its head up for a curiou sniff. It has the tracer fastened to its neck with a curr band. Furious, Qualen FIRES at the rabbit -- it safely sp away as Qualen smashes the useless tracer monitor and tur around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the heat scope. The blip that represents Hal -- vanish Delmer, who has caught up, is at the edge of the tree-lin area -- he looks up at Travers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keying headset radio) He's hiding twenty yards in -- be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "replies", beeping twice on the headset's ear button as h moves downhill into the woods, closely following Hal's tracks -- they lead up to the replanted "BITKER" sign. Ju big enough to hide behind. Delmer smiles, and advances to the sign -- -- and looks behind it. Nothing but a mound of snow. Delm looks again to the tracks, which lead toward

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL ROCK FORMATION
dialogues.text: also big enough to conceal Hal. Delmer moves toward it as

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE "BITKER" SIGN
dialogues.text: the mound of snow shifts as Hal climbs out, silently shak off the cover -- the snow hid him not only from Delmer, b from the heat scope as well --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS IN HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: hovers overhead, watching Delmer's blip on the heat scope but Hal's blip returns, rushing ahead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keying headset radio) He's right behind you!

dialogues.speaker: DELMER
dialogues.text: whirls around at the warning, his gun BLAZING, but Hal is fast -- he swings the sign like a club, knocking Delmer's away into the snow. Before Hal can swing again, Delmer brutally punches Hal in the face -- stunned, Hal drops th sign --

dialogues.speaker: IN HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Travers can't do anything now but watch the heat scope as it were a video game -- now it's just one big blip --

dialogues.speaker: DELMER AND HAL
dialogues.text: thrash around in the snow, pummelling each other -- Hal's getting the worst of it, as Delmer manages to get on top him and deliver a series of punishing blows to his face. to end it, Delmer tries to get the bolt gun off a clip on front pack strap -- but he has trouble unfastening it. Ha rallies with a solid punch to Delmer's face. Hal gets Del off of him and follows with two more. Delmer is knocked away, landing on the sign board -- but from Hal -- another chance to get the bolt gun off -- Hal quickly moves to the sign and grabs its post -- befor Delmer can move off the sign's board, Hal's running forwa shoving the sign ahead of him with Delmer on top -- Hal l go, and the sign, with Delmer, sleds downhill on the hard packed snow --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS IN HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: can now see one blip moving quickly away from the other -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Something's moving fast down the hill -- is it Tucker?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: has found Delmer's fallen headset radio and put it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Answer me! Is it Tucker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal smiles and beeps twice -- affirmative.

dialogues.speaker: IN HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Happy at last, Travers takes off after the blip, flying d the incline and staying just above the trees, strafing an intense fusillade at

dialogues.speaker: DELMER
dialogues.text: who's screaming as a storm of bullets rip through him and sign and the surrounding snow, keeping pace with his down slide --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS IN HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: FIRES until his clip is empty -- he heads for the end of tree line as his target comes out, skidding to a stop in snow. Travers gleefully moves lower down for a closer loo but is shocked to see

dialogues.speaker: DELMER
dialogues.text: Delmer's highly perforated body rolls off the sign as it finally skids to a dead halt.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: who is apoplectic -- he's just shot one of his own men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Thanks loads. (beat) I couldn't have killed him without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers looks down at the heat scope -- blank.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: is hiding his body "heat" under a rock formation.

dialogues.speaker: IN HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Stymied, Travers furiously banks it away from the wooded and circles around the mountain's other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe, hands on his head, moves down a slope near a mounta edge, ahead of Kristel, who's aiming her gun at his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much further?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops) It's right over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe nods ahead, indicating what looks like a

dialogues.speaker: A SHED
dialogues.text: that is partially obscured by snow, about twenty feet dis across a snowy plateau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a storage locker for the rangers. Everything you need to get off the mountain is in there -- skiis, food -- I'll show you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe shows a sudden burst of enthusiasm and starts quickl moving ahead again -- Kristel suspiciously notices this -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristel gets ahead of Gabe and walks backward, keeping he trained on him as she crunches through the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skiis, food -- and maybe guns too, right? (moves backward) Keep walking. Not too close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd make better time walking straight ahead. Qualen's not going to be hopping down the bunny trail too much longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking backward) Right. So I'd better have one less problem when he arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knowing this means him) Don't fuck up. You still need me to show you a route off the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've worn that one out, Walker -- (snaps back bolt) -- I'll find my own way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristel solidly plants her feet firmly to shoot Gabe, but feet sink through the crystallized snow cover -- -- Kristel completely disappears down through the snow as it collapses under her -- she's pulling the trigger and SHOT go wild as she sinks and sinks --

dialogues.speaker: ON GABE
dialogues.text: who's had to drop flat on his stomach to avoid the same fate -- as he scrambles back to solid land, Kristel's SHO arc up through the snow toward him, and the snow crumbles around him -- but he bellies ahead as --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SNOWDRIFT'S TOP
dialogues.text: Kristel's GUNSHOTS slow, and finally, stop, the very last them loosening the snow around --

dialogues.speaker: THE "SHED"
dialogues.text: that was obscured by snow was a tall, three-sided park se sign shouting "WARNING -- SNOWDRIFT -- DO NOT CROSS" in e different languages. The rest of the snow falls away from revealing a cautionary but cheesy illustration -- a stick-figure fatally sinking into the snow.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: bellies ahead, flat on his stomach, testing the snow with ice axe's staff -- only when he hits something solid with does he get back up to his feet. But the sound of ice-cru snow CRUNCHING above Gabe alerts him that --

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN
dialogues.text: has just hit the top of the slope and spotted him -- Qual gun BLAZES down --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: is on the run, but it's that lead-footed, slow motion stu that only happens in nightmares -- with every step, a foo breaks through the icy crust and sinks into two feet of snow -- Gabe stays just ahead of the barrage, making it i

dialogues.speaker: A THICK WOODED AREA
dialogues.text: which is very temporary refuge -- Qualen will be down in seconds. Gabe looks down the slope. Running is impractica he sits down.

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN
dialogues.text: arrives where Gabe was and looks down the slope --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: is whizzing down the slope in a sitting position, using h back and his shoes as gliders, the ice axe as a rudder. Alpinists call this a "sitting glissade". Colorado climbe call it "butt skiing". Some psychos do this for fun.

dialogues.speaker: THE SLIDE
dialogues.text: is anything but fun -- Gabe can't control his speed or direction well at all -- Gabe barely manages to steer in out of trees and boulders in his path --

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN
dialogues.text: starts running down the slope -- he doesn't have speed, b does have the machine gun -- he FIRES short bursts at --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: who tries to steer away from the line of fire -- Gabe is in the shoulder -- he slides out of control, and rolls do -- to the slope's bottom. Gabe painfully lifts himself up moves through the woods, coming out of the trees to

dialogues.speaker: THE LAKE
dialogues.text: The bridge that spans it is ahead of Gabe -- but there is nothing around but flat terrain. It's a beautiful sight, no good for hiding. And Qualen is right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rushes down to Delmer's body -- in the snow, he finds the discarded machine gun and holds it up, but stray bullets Travers' fusillade have made it inoperable. Hal tosses it aside and checks Delmer's bloody pockets for more weapons Nothing. Just a couple of machine gun clips, and the bolt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is wending her way down a hiking trail on the opposite si the mountain. In plain view,

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS IN HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: is circling the mountain -- he spots Maggie from on high moves down after her.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: hears the helicopter, and turns around -- she has no way knowing it isn't Frank, so she takes off her jacket and w it as a signal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank! Down here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter moves down until Maggie can see --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: is at the controls.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: starts running, but it's useless. Nowhere to hide. Traver hovers over her, FIRING ahead of her, FIRING behind her, to kill, just to make a point. He's in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie finally stops -- Travers lands the copter and open passenger door, keeping his gun trained on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hop in. I know someone who'd like to see you again before he dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moves down to the slope's edge, noting with pleasure the in the snow. Gabe is wounded, and he's left a trail as a bonus. Qualen moves out lakeside -- nothing visible but the thic flat ice chunks circling in the currents. But Gabe's footprints and blood lead straight ahead to the bridge. Qualen starts to run across the bridge, but stares down -

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIDGE'S PLANKS
dialogues.text: The blood -- and slush from Gabe's boots -- end halfway across.

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN
dialogues.text: Smiles and shakes his head. Too obvious. Gabe is hiding underneath the bridge, in the three foot deep network of supports. Qualen slows his pace, staring down through the thin, but visible cracks between the planks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grimacing, shivering, ashen from his wound and exertion - lined shadows on his face confirm he is under the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've come a long way to die.

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN
dialogues.text: enjoying himself, slams a fresh clip into his machine gun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were smart, you'd have left your friend behind. I would have. There's no shame in staying alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen stops, staring down. Through the gaps, Gabe's park visible. Right where the blood trail ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aims down) But you're not smart. And now you're going to die from an overdose of heroism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qualen BLAZES the gun into the planks --

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: is clinging to the steel supports of the small bridge, several feet ahead of where his empty parka is being shredded by the FUSILLADE -- without the parka, Gabe is freezing, and too many bullets are coming too close for comfort as they RICOCHET on the bridge's supports --

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN
dialogues.text: stops firing and kicks away the planks, which are a tangl toothpicks at this point -- Qualen bends down -- -- and sees there's nothing in the parka except for Gabe' back. Qualen's face registers anger and surprise as -- -- appears at the edge of the hole -- before Qualen can reac Gabe swings up with his ice axe, hooking it around the shoulder strap of Qualen's machine gun -- Gabe yanks down and Qualen falls head first

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: with Gabe -- Qualen catches himself by hooking an arm and leg on one of the steel supports -- but both

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE AXE AND THE GUN
dialogues.text: fall, landing on separate chunks of ice floating undernea the bridge --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SUPPORTS
dialogues.text: Gabe pulls himself through the girders to Qualen and punc him with his good arm, but Qualen is unfazed -- neither a good position, it's like a fistfight on a jungle gym -- - Qualen steadies himself to savagely punch Gabe in his shoulder wound -- Gabe YELLS in pain and tries to block t next one, but Qualen punches him again, and Gabe lets go the support, falling -- -- on the way down, Gabe grabs Qualen's leg with his good hand -- too low to grab the br Gabe dangles just over the water, raising his legs above Qualen tries to kick him off -- -- Gabe holds onto Qualen leg, and swings on it like a pendulum -- Gabe twists the -- Qualen loses his grip on the icy steel and lets go -- both

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN AND GABE
dialogues.text: fall -- they land hard, not in the water, but on a raft-sized chunk of ice driven under the bridge by the current. Their weight teeter-totters the ice as they get they're in danger not just from each other, but from

dialogues.speaker: THE FAST APPROACHING WHIRLPOOL
dialogues.text: where the ice chunks are drawn into the fiercely swirling vortex that drains into the waterfall --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ICE RAFT
dialogues.text: Qualen and Gabe circle each other like cautious boxers, a ice itself swirls in the current -- if either makes the w move, they'll both go over. Gabe swings at Qualen, but Qu throws a leg under Gabe and stiff-arms him down -- Gabe h the ice hard, his chest hanging over the side -- Qualen m in to shove him off -- but their combined weight on the s side of the ice starts to tip it over -- Gabe viciously kicks Qualen back, gashing his face with his boot's cramp Qualen grabs the ice raft's opposite side, levelling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wiping the gash) Stalemate, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winded) Not any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe, still prone, reaches out -- the chunk of ice with Qualen's machine gun is floating by. Gabe snatches up the and pulls the trigger. Nothing but an empty CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far more intimidating when it's loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chunk of ice with Gabe's ice axe floats by Gabe -- Ga grabs for it, but misses -- as the ice raft spins around, Qualen manages to snatch it up -- Qualen scythes it down Gabe, slamming the blade into the ice as Gabe rolls away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is nearing the center of the whirlpool -- the current is faster and stronger here -- if it doesn't swallow the ice raft, it will definitely upend it --

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN AND GABE
dialogues.text: stay on opposite sides of the ice raft for balance -- Qua swings out at Gabe with the axe. Gabe ducks and tries to low to hit Qualen with the gun, but Qualen swings the axe again, whizzing right past Gabe as it sinks into --

dialogues.speaker: THE CENTER OF THE ICE RAFT
dialogues.text: -- a crack spiderwebs through the ice around the blade --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: quickly reacts, jumping onto another bed-sized chunk of i floating by, landing on his stomach and braking himself b digging his crampons in -- just as --

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN
dialogues.text: realizing what deep shit he's in, looks for another chunk ice to make the same move -- to sees one just out of reac Qualen pulls the ice axe out of the raft's center to drag other chunk closer in -- -- as he does, the entire raft disintegrates under him -- Qualen plunges into the water, tries to maintain a slippery grip on what ice is left -- -- but now at the center of the whirlpool, Qualen is draw into the vortex --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: struggles to his feet and looks down, wincing --

dialogues.speaker: QUALEN GOING DOWN
dialogues.text: Qualen's inaudible scream is just a burst of rising bubbl he shoots down to the bottom of the lake -- and beyond --

dialogues.speaker: UNDERWATER
dialogues.text: Qualen is shoved with incredible force and speed through lake's tunnel drain --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOUNTAIN WALL
dialogues.text: BLASTS OUT full force, hurling a still thrashing Qualen a half a mile to the ground below!

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: has no time to celebrate -- the chunk of ice he's on leav him moments from the same fate. One more time around, and it's down the drain. Gabe takes a deep breath. No choice. leaps --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- from one chunk of ice to the other, running the way yo would across stones in a stream, zig-zagging to catch the big enough to support him -- only his crampons keep him f sliding off, only his momentum keeps him from capsizing t ice chunks, which shoots away from him in his wake --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: lands on an ice raft floating towards the bridge. No choi Gabe lunges off the ice raft and reaches for one of the b supports -- his hand catches -- but it's slippery and he' weakened -- Gabe slides off, but --

dialogues.speaker: A HAND
dialogues.text: reaches down and grabs him --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: pulls Gabe the rest of the way onto the bridge. Gabe's surprise gives way to a grin almost as big as Hal's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing Gabe's ruined shirt) Nice outfit. (hands him his parka) I know you never liked the orange, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't care for the Smokey The Bear hats, either. That's why I quit. (pulls on parka) You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel better than you look. I can live with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe looks down at the parka -- it's completely full of bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly seems worth zipping, huh? (serious now) Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal sobers -- shakes his head no. A cloud passes over Gab face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not over, Gabe. Travers took the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Maggie's hands are cuffed to a bar on the helicopter's ro Travers keys his headset radio while piloting the copter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Qualen -- Kristel -- come in --

dialogues.speaker: HAL AND GABE ON BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Gabe hears Hal's borrowed headset radio crackling -- he h his hand out to Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I? (dons it, keys it) They can't talk right now, Travers. Kristel's busy making snow angels -- and I'm not sure, but I think Qualen is still falling. (radio silence) Any messages?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment's silence -- then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Gabe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keying it) Maggie --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE COPTER
dialogues.text: yanks the radio off Maggie and puts it back on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) You wanted to make a trade earlier, Walker -- still interested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) I've got the money. Fly to the lake. And if you touch her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers cuts off the radio, smiles, and banks the helicop down around the mountain wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no fucking idea. (holds Qualen's gun) Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Not for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal fishes into his pockets and pulls out one of the ammo clips he took from Delmer, Gabe tries to force it into th gun's stock -- but it's the wrong size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sagging against rail) Why can't anything be easy?

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: thunders around the mountain wall, getting closer --

dialogues.speaker: HAL AND GABE
dialogues.text: have crossed the bridge, near the mountain edge -- Gabe, wearing his pack again, nods over to the wooded area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay over there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- let me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what, throw snowballs at him? Just -- whatever happens -- get Maggie out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relenting) Count on it. (beat) And Gabe? Thanks for tagging along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Thanks for asking. I forgot how much I enjoyed rescue work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe limps toward the mountain's edge as Hal runs into th woods.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: blasts along the wall towards the lake -- the waterfall a the ladder are just ahead. The copter radio crackles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from radio) Come in, Rocky Mountain Rescue -- urgent -- come in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers recognizes the voice -- frowning, he snaps off th radio and banks the helicopter up over the top --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS IN HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: tops the precipice, revealing Gabe, standing on the end o narrow spur -- it just out from the edge like a diving bo Gabe has his pack on one arm -- the money is visible. Gab levels Qualen's emptied gun on Travers and the copter -- bluff is all he has left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Remember that bet you made? About whether I could find the money for you or not? (holds pack over drop) You won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers helplessly flies in low, tight circles over Gabe the spur -- if he shoots Gabe, the money falls too, Trave presses his gun at Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) I'll kill her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) You do, and the spring thaw's going to be worth thirty million bucks. (pause) No rush. I'm sure you've got lots of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) All right. Drop the gun first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) When she's safe on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers has no choice but to give in -- he gives Maggie t handcuff key, and she frees herself as he flies away from spur, touching the copter down on the mountain top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Maggie) Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie moves out the door and stares uncertainly at Gabe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Run! (she doesn't) Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie runs for the trees. When Gabe is sure she's safe, throws the gun away -- but keeps the pack suspended over edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Now come and get it. My arm's getting tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers flies the copter up and over, until he and it are feet away from Gabe's position on the spur. Gabe is buffe by the copter's wind, but stands firm. Travers levels his at Gabe through the open passenger door as Gabe heaves th pack in. Travers doesn't even look down -- he just stares Gabe with hate as he prepares to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Don't you want to count it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puzzled, Travers takes his gun hand and rips open

dialogues.speaker: THE PACK
dialogues.text: The $5000s are there -- but they've been shredded by Qualen's earlier blast of gunfire. Few, if any, of the bi are passable.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: stares down, incredulous -- as he does --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: rips open a perforated section of parka and yanks his bol gun from his waist -- Travers looks up and raises his gun at Gabe -- but Gabe f first -- the bolt imbeds itself high in Travers' chest. Gasping, Travers drops his gun -- it falls over the pack out the open door -- Travers clutches at his chest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't spend it all in one place, you son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers falls back in his seat and loses control of the helicopter -- it spins around, and Gabe has to instantly flatten to avoid the tail when it swings at him -- Gabe l down as --

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: quickly begins to spiral down in wide, aimless circles -- Travers has clearly lost control --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: stares down coldly, waiting for the crash -- but --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE COPTER
dialogues.text: won't give up -- sweating, bleeding, he sits forward and grabs the stick, seizing control of the helicopter again

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: stops its uncontrolled descent and begins to rise up and up -- with clear purpose --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: eyes widening with realization. Gabe gets up from the spu starts running back towards the woods -- several hundred from safety -- before he can get very far --

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: tops the precipice edge and, sweeping low over the snow, gets between Gabe and the trees, cutting him off --

dialogues.speaker: WOODED AREA
dialogues.text: watch, powerless --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to run Gabe down --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS IN HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Ashen, hyperventilating, he's running on pure adrenalin a fury as he drives the stick forward --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: is stiff-legging it toward the edge of the mountain -- bu he's too banged up to run fast through the thick snow --

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: with its skids skipping just over the snow overtakes --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: as he throws himself flat into the snow -- the front of t skid misses Gabe by inches as it blasts over him --

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: moves out over the precipice edge -- Travers banks it wid circle back around for another run --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: gets back up as the helicopter swings back behind him --

dialogues.speaker: IN A WOODED AREA
dialogues.text: Hal rips the lining out of one of his pockets and stuffs into one of the ammo clips -- Maggie stays back as he run all he's worth out into the clearing --

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: has circled back around, stopping at a hover far back in clearing -- Travers intends to not just run Gabe over, bu run him off the edge as well --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: lumbers as fast as he can towards the edge --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: knows he has Gabe nailed -- he shoves the stick forward -

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: flies forward, skids just inches over the snow --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: runs out to where Travers is heading -- he lights the clo in the ammo clip -- as

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: flies past

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CLEARING
dialogues.text: Hal hurls the clip, with its cloth "fuse" burning down, i the doorless side of the copter --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: -- the makeshift bomb bounces to the floor of the cockpit Travers sees it and looks down, but --

dialogues.speaker: THE "FUSE"
dialogues.text: sputters out -- nothing but glowing embers in the cloth -

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: smiles -- nothing to worry about -- he speeds ahead --

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER'S SKIDS
dialogues.text: as they slice through the top of the snow towards --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: as he runs toward the mountain's edge -- it's just a coup feet ahead, but the copter is a couple of feet behind -- -- as the copter overtakes Gabe, dipping even lower into snow, he dives off the edge --

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING GABE
dialogues.text: Gabe is at the ladder -- he falls the first twenty feet o long drop, then grabs a rung on the cable ladder, very painfully stopping his fall -- but in the same split seco

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: skid meant to impale Gabe catches the top two rungs of th cable ladder --

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: -- caught in the rungs of the cable ladder, the helicopte keeps flying out over the abyss, but as it pulls the cabl ladder, it pops out the bolts that hold the ladder in pla rung by rung -- -- still going full tilt, the copter stra against the ladder -- thirty feet of it tethers the copte to the wall -- -- and Gabe is dangling from the center of it.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LADDER
dialogues.text: has one arm hooked around a rung, hanging on for his life the copter thrashes the ladder up and down --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE COPTER
dialogues.text: Travers is disoriented by the jolt, and tries to maintain control -- he doesn't see -- -- that the cloth fuse on the ammo clip has reignited -- burns down to the clip, and fifty rounds explode like a string of firecrackers -- -- Travers tries to shield himself as he is struck by air lead. Shrapnel blasts into the instrument panel --

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: still strains against the cable ladder but the engine goe dead -- the rotor blades slow --

dialogues.speaker: GABE ON LADDER
dialogues.text: Gabe stares in horror at the stalling rotor -- if it were possible for him to grip the ladder tighter, he'd do it n

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: -- as the rotor WHOPS to a dead halt the copter arcs down and slams against the mountain wall -- the skids are stil caught in the ladder, and it holds --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: is shaken off by the massive impact -- he falls -- -- landing on the helicopter, half in and half out of the cockpit! As Gabe scrambles for a solid hold --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Travers, who has been shaken to the opposite side of t copter, reaches into his jacket and pulls out the pistol took from Frank -- he aims at Gabe --

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER SKID
dialogues.text: One of the two rungs holding the copter up bursts --

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: slips, now hanging from just a single rung -- -- and the impact of the slip makes Travers drop the gun -- it falls the open passenger door. Travers scrambles up through the cabin to go after -- -- Gabe, who is trying to get off th helicopter and onto a solid part of the ladder before the whole thing goes down --           Gabe jumps for the wal Travers scrambles behind him and --

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER SKID
dialogues.text: -- as the last rung supporting the copter snaps in two --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: grabs hold of the ladder as

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: plummets down -- but as it starts its fall --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVERS
dialogues.text: leaps from the falling copter and grabs Gabe's leg -- Gab struggles to support both of them, but Travers, weakened his wound, loses his grip on Gabe's leg -- he stares up i terror at Gabe as he clutches Gabe's snow-slick boot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheer up. It's a beautiful spot to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travers slides off and away --

dialogues.speaker: THE FALL
dialogues.text: Travers SCREAMING as he free falls, trailing behind the helicopter -- we follow the entire four thousand foot dro -- until the helicopter explodes when it hits the ground below, and the fireball engulfs Travers just before he impacts into the explosion!

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: looks down at the burning wreck and clings to the ladder, closing his eyes for a moment in exhaustion. But the WHOP of another helicopter makes him look up --

dialogues.speaker: THE TREASURY HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: has shown up, a little too late to be of any help.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TREASURY COPTER
dialogues.text: Wright, Davis and Stuart look at the billowing flames of wreck -- even from here, the burning money is visible, drifting up in the smoke. Wright turns to Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no expert -- but what do you make of that "event"?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: is drained -- from somewhere, he finds the strength to li his head up --

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL
dialogues.text: The section of ladder above him, of course, is gone -- he to cover the fifty feet of wall above him by free climbin There are holds that look easy enough for him, but --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: leans back, gripping the ladder, too tired to move. Just thought of one more climb drains him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling) Forget it. No fucking way. I'm staying right here. I've spent the night on walls before -- some of the best nights of my life have been spent lashed to walls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Gabe can take this any farther -- a loop tied to t end of a rope falls to a stop next to him. Gabe looks up

dialogues.speaker: ON THE EDGE
dialogues.text: has thrown the line down. Maggie is by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember -- keep your arms and legs in the vehicle at all times --

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: puts the loop around himself and tightens it by rote -- e this action aches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too tired to shout) Fuck you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal and Maggie draw Gabe up -- Gabe pulls some of his wei by using hand and foot holds, but when he reaches

dialogues.speaker: THE PRECIPICE EDGE
dialogues.text: Hal and Maggie are both winded from the effort as they ha Gabe onto the top. Gabe unties himself, and collapses int Maggie's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winded, coiling the rope) Jesus Christ -- you think you could have put a little less effort into that climb? I mean, what have you done for me -- lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal ends his harrangue and looks over -- Gabe has apparen revived, because he and Maggie are locked in the kiss of lives. Hal stands, and smiles -- he walks toward the Trea agents, who are scrambling out of the helicopter. Hal sta an explanation that's going to take a long, long time as

dialogues.speaker: GABE AND MAGGIE
dialogues.text: break off their kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this mean you're staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Gabe's answering smile, we --
